SourceText: *Tummy Time Safari*
text: *Isikhathi Sesafari Yokulala ngesisu*

SourceText: Time for an adventure - right on the floor! 🌱
text: Isikhathi se-adventure - lapha phansi! 🌱

SourceText: ✅ Lay a soft blanket on the floor and gently place your baby on their tummy. Put a few colourful toys or soft books just out of reach, and see your baby reach for them.
text: Ndlala ublankethi ontofontofo phansi ulalise ingane yakho ngesisu. Beka amathoyizi ayimibalabala noma izincwadi ezithambile kujana lapho, bese ubuka ingane ifinyelela kuzona.

SourceText: 👀 Talk, sing, or lie down face-to-face to keep them engaged.
text: 👀Khuluma, ucule, noma ulale ngaphambi kwayo nibukane ukuze uyenze izizwe eixhumene nawe.

SourceText: 🧸 Make it playful - wiggle a toy or a plastic bottle with some rice like an animal exploring the jungle! “Look, here comes a lion!”
text: 🧸Yenza kube umdlalo - nyakazisa ithoyizi noma ibhodlela leplastikhi elinerayisi njengesilwane sihlola ihlathi! "Buka nakhu sekuqhamuka ibhubesi!"

SourceText: Tummy time is essential for your baby’s physical development and builds the strength they’ll need to crawl and sit ⭐
text: Isikhathi sokulala ngesisu sibalulekile ukuthuthukisa ukukhula komzimba wengane yakho futhi kwakha amandla ewadingayo ukuthi ikhase kanye nokuhlala ⭐

SourceText: *Face to Face Fun*
text: *Ubumnandi bokubukana ubuso nobuso*

SourceText: Babies love looking at faces - especially yours! 😃
text: Izingane ziyathanda ukubuka ubuso - obakho ikakhulukazi! 😃

SourceText: 👑 Sit comfortably and hold your baby so you’re face-to-face. Make funny faces, raise your eyebrows, puff your cheeks, and talk or sing gently.
text: 👑 Hlala unethezeke uphathe ingane yakho ngendlela yokuthi niyabukana. Yenza ubuso obuhlekisayo, unyuse amashiya, futha izidlathi zakho futhi ukhulume noma ucule ngesizotha.

SourceText: 🚩 Watch as your baby starts to copy you! Peek-a-boo and big smiles are great ways to bond.
text: 🚩 Buka nkathi ingane yakho iqala ukukulingisela! Umdlalo ka Mbophe phoyisa nokumamatheka izindlela ezinhle yokuxhumana.

SourceText: This activity helps your baby develop emotional connection, eye contact, and early social skills - all while having fun together 🎉
text: Lomsebenzi usiza ekuthuthukiseni ukuxhumana ngokomoya, ukuxhumana ngokubukana, kanye namakhono okuqala ukuxhumana enganeni yakho- konke lokhu ngesikhathi nijabula ndawonye 🎉

SourceText: *Sing & Sway*
text: *Cula futhi uNyakazise umzimba*

SourceText: 🎵 Hold your baby close and gently sway together to the rhythm of a soft song. You can hum or sing a lullaby as you move, making eye contact and smiling as you go.
text: 🎵 Gona ingane yakho unyakaze nayo nilandela ingoma edlalela phansi. Ungacula ingoma yokulala ngenkathi unyakaza, nibukane futhi umamatheke ngenkathi uqhubeka.

SourceText: 🔄 Try singing the same song each day - it creates a lovely routine and helps your baby recognise familiar sounds over time.
text: 🔄Zama ukucula ingoma eyodwa zonke izinsuku- lokhu kwakha injwayelo yokuthi ingane yakho ikwazi ukuzwa imisindo ejwayelekile ekuhambeni kwesikhathi.

SourceText: The soothing movement helps your baby feel safe and connected, while the sound of your voice supports early language development and emotional bonding 💛
text: Ukunyakaza okuthuthuzelayo nengane yakho kusiza ekutheni izizwe iphephile futhi ixhumene nawe, ngenkath izwi lakho leseka ukuthuthukisa kolimi nesikhathi sokuxhumana ngokozwelo

SourceText: It’s a simple, calming way to bond and build your baby’s growing brain through rhythm, movement, and love 🌙
text: Yindlela elula, yokuxhumana ngesizotha futhi iwakha ngesigqi, umnyakazo nothando umqondo okhulayo wengane yakho 🌙

SourceText: *Toe Tickle Talk*
text: *Ingxoxo ngokukitaza izinzwane*

SourceText: Let’s explore toes and fingers with a gentle tickle and some fun words! 👋
text: Make sihlole ukukitazwa ngokumnene ezinzwaneni nase minweni yezandla namagama amunandi! 👋

SourceText: ▶️ Start by wiggling your baby’s toes or fingers one at a time while counting them, saying your own silly rhyme, or simply naming the toes and fingers: “Tickle your tiny toe!” or “Hello little thumb!”
text: ▶️ Qala ngokunyakazisa izinzwane noma iminwe ngakunye ngakunye ngesikhathi ubala, ube uzisholo ingoma yakho ehlekisayo, noma usho izinzwane neminwe ngamagama" Kitaza ucikicane" noma "Sawubona sthupha esincane!"

SourceText: This activity strengthens your baby’s awareness of their body and supports early language learning - all while sharing giggles and smiles 🎉
text: Lo msebenzi uqinisa ukuthi ingane yakho iqaphele umzimba wayo futhi yeseka ekufundeni ulimi masinyane - konke ngesikhathi nihleka nimamatheka 🎉

SourceText: *Follow the Sound*
text: *Landela umsindo*

SourceText: Let’s explore the world of sound! 📻
text: Make sihlole umhlaba womsindo

SourceText: 💡 Find something in your house that makes a gentle sound, like some rice in a packet or a plastic bag.
text: 💡 Thola into enomsindo omnene lapho endlini yakho, njenge rayisi elisephaketheni noma kuplastikhi.

SourceText: 👂 Gently make a sound with the object near your baby’s ear - first on one side, then pause and try the other.
text: 👂 Yenza umsindo omnene ngalento oyitholile uwenzele eduzane nendlebe yengane - uqale kolunye uhlangothi, bese uphumula kancane bese uzama eduze kwenye kolunye uhlangothi.

SourceText: 👀 Watch how your baby turns their head to follow the noise. You can even say, “Over here!” as you move the sound.
text: 👀 Buka ukuthi ingane yakho iliphendula kanjani ikhanda ilandela umsindo. Ungasho ukuthi "Ngapha" ngesikhathi unyakazisa uwuhambisa umsindo.

SourceText: This is a lovely, quiet way to play together - and it helps your baby start to understand how sound connects to movement. It supports their attention and brain development 🌱
text: Lena indlela enhle ezothile yokudlala ndawonye - futhi isiza ingane yakho ekutheni iqale ukuqonda ukuthi umsindo nomnyakazo kuxhumana kanjani. Yeseka ukuqaphela nokukhula komqondo

SourceText: *Story Cuddles*
text: *Izindaba nigonene*

SourceText: It’s never too early to share a story! 📖
text: Akusheshile ukuxoxa indaba! 📖

SourceText: 👂 Hold your baby close and tell them a simple story – you can tell them about your day or memories from when you were young, or you can make up a short story.
text: 👂 Gona ingane yakho uyixoxele indaba elula -ungayixoxela ngosuku lwakho noma okukhumbulayo ngezikhathi zakho usemncane noma ungazakhela indaba emfushane.

SourceText: 💙 Your baby may not understand what you are saying yet, but the sound of your voice, your expressions, and the closeness all help them feel safe and connected.
text: 💙 Kungenzeka ingane ingakuqondi okushoyo ngalesosikhathi, kodwa umsindo wephimbo lakho, indlela oyibeka ngayo indaba, ukusondelana, konke lokhu kungayisiza izizwe iphephile futhi kunokuxhumana.

SourceText: 👀 If you share a story from a book, you can point to pictures and describe what you see: “Look, a dog! The dog is playing outside.”
text: Uma umfundela indaba esencwadini, ungakhomba izithombe futhi uchaze okubonayo: "Buka, inja! Inja idlala ngaphandle."

SourceText: Story telling builds language, imagination, and a love of stories and reading - right from the start. And cuddling up together makes it even more special ✨
text: Ukuxoxelana izindaba kwakha ulimi, umcabango, ukuthanda izingxoxo kanye nokufunda - kusaqala. Futhi kwenza nokugonana kube okukhethekile kakhulu ✨

SourceText: *Name That Sound*
text: *Qamba lowomsindo

SourceText: Make everyday noises into a fun game! 🎵
text: Yenza umsindo wansuku zonke kube umdlalo omnandi! 🎵

SourceText: 🔑 Use objects like a crinkly bag, keys, or tapping a cup. Make a sound and then pause.
text: 🔑 Sebenzisa izinto ezifana nesikhwama esigoqiwe esihlofozelayo, okhiye noma ushaye inkomishi. Yenza umsindo bese uyama kancane.

SourceText: 👂 Say what it is: “Crinkle, crinkle! That’s the bag!” or “Clink clink! That’s the keys!” Watch your baby’s reaction - do they turn toward the sound? Do they smile or blink?
text: 👂 Yisho ukuthi yini: "Hlofo, hlofo! Isikhwama lesi" noma "Khence khence! Okhiye laba "Buka ukuthi ingane yakho izokwenzenjani - ingabe iphendukela ngalapho ekunomsindo khona? Ingabe uyamamatheka noma uyacwayiza?

SourceText: This activity builds your baby’s listening and attention skills while helping them begin to link sounds to the world around them.
text: Lomsebenzi wakha ikhono lokulalela kwengane yakho nokuqaphela ngenkathi futhi iyisiza ekuxhumaniseni umsindo nomhlaba omzungezile.

SourceText: Even the smallest sounds can open up a big world of discovery! 🌈
text: Ngisho nomsindo omncane kakhulu ungavulela amathuba okubona umhlaba omkhulu! 🌈

SourceText: *Follow the Beat*
text: *Landela Isigqi*

SourceText: 🎵 Use your hands to gently clap or pat a simple rhythm on your little one’s legs or arms: “Ta-ta-ta... ta-ta!”
text: 🎵 Sebenzisa izandla zakho uzishaye ngesizotha noma umbambathe isigqi esilula emilenzeni noma ezingalweni zengane yakho: "Ta-ta-ta... ta-ta"!

SourceText: 😃 Then pause and smile - do they respond? Your little one may wiggle, kick, or if they are a bit older they may even copy the rhythm.
text: 😃 Bese uyema kancane umamatheke - ngabe iyaphendula? Ingane yakho inganyakaza, ikhahlele noma ingasikopela leso sigqi uma ithe ukukhula kancane.

SourceText: This playful call-and-response builds listening, rhythm, and connection - just like traditional music has done for generations 💚
text: Lomdlalo wokubiza - uphendula ufundisa ingane ukulalela, isigqi, nokuxhumana - njengomculo wesintu wawenza kwizizukulwane 💚

SourceText: *Scarf Peekabo*
text: *Ukuzifihla nokubonisa ngesikhafu*

SourceText: It’s peekaboo time - with a twist! 🎁
text: Isikhathi sokuzifihla uziveze - okunomehluko! 🎁

SourceText: 🔶 Grab a soft scarf or cloth and gently hide your face behind it.
text: 🔶 Thatha isikhafu esintofontofo noma indwangu uzifihle ubuso ngayo.

SourceText: 👋 Then slowly pull it away and say, “Peekaboo!” with a big smile.
text: 👋 Kancane, kancane uyidonse sakuyivula bese uthi " Ngiyakubona!" ngokukhulu ukumamatheka.

SourceText: 🧸 Try hiding your baby’s favourite toy or your baby’s feet too. Each reveal is a surprise, sparking joy and curiosity!
text: 🧸 Zama ukufihla ithoyizi lengane yakho eliyintandokazi noma izinyawo zayo. Ngakunye ngakunye akube okumangazayo, kuvuselele injabulo nolukuluku!

SourceText: This playful activity encourages visual tracking, helps build anticipation, and supports early social interaction 👀
text: Lomdlalo ugqugquzela ukulandela ngamehlo, kusiza ukwakha ukulangazelela, nokweseka ukuxhumana nomphakathi ngokushesha 👀

SourceText: Peekaboo is more than just fun - it teaches your baby that things (and people!) still exist, even when they’re out of sight ✨
text: Umdlalo wokucashelana ungaphezu kokujabulisa - ufundisa ingane yakho ukuthi izinto zisekhona (nabantu) basekhona, noma bengekho phambi kwamehlo ethu ✨

SourceText: Adapted from UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=trQ1tFuagzQ
text: Iguqulwe kusuka kwibhokisi lokudlala lakwa UNICEF: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=trQ1tFuagzQ

SourceText: *Mirror Moments*
text: *Izikhathi sesibuko*

SourceText: It’s time to meet someone special - themselves! 👋
text: Yisikhathi sokuhlangana nomuntu obalulekile - yen'uqobo! 👋

SourceText: 😃 Stand in front of a mirror or reflecting window with your little one and watch their reaction.
text: 😃 Ima ngaphambi kwesibuko noma iwindi elicwebezelayo nengane yakho ubuke ukuthi uzokwenzenjani.

SourceText: 👀 You can point to their nose or eyes and name them aloud: “There’s your nose!”
text: 👀 Ungakhomba ikhala noma amehlo akhe uzisho ngamagama azo kakhulu:"Nali ikhala lakho!"

SourceText: 🚩 For older babies, encourage them to touch the mirror or make faces. Smile, wave, and copy their movements!
text: 🚩 Ezinganeni esezikhulakhulile, zigqugquzele ukuthinta isibuko noma benze ubuso obuhlukahlukene. Mamatheka, valelisa bese wena ukopela umnyakazo yayo!

SourceText: Mirrors support self-awareness, recognition, and early language development - plus, they’re lots of fun! 💙
text: Izibuko zisekela ukuziqaphela, ukuqashelwa nokuthuthukisa ukukhula kolimi ngokushesha - futhi lokhu kuyajabulisa! 💙

SourceText: *Texture Treasure Hunt*
text: *Ukuzingela Umcebo Wezinto Ezahlukahlukene Ezithintwayo*

SourceText: Let’s explore the world through touch! 🌱
text: Make sihlole umhlaba ngokuthinta! 🌱

SourceText: ✅ Collect safe objects with different textures - like a soft sock, a wooden spoon, a smooth ball, or a crinkly wrapper.
text: ✅ Qokelela izinto eziphephile ezingazwakali ngokufana uma uzithinta - njengesokisi elintofontofo, isipuni sepulangwe, ibhola elibushelelezi noma iphepha elihlofozelayo.

SourceText: 👋 Gently guide your baby’s hands over each item and describe them: “Soft,” “Bumpy,” “Cold.”
text: 👋 Hola ingane yakho ngesandla kuzo zonke lezi zinto futhi uzichaze: "Ithambile," "Iyabhampa," " Iyabanda."

SourceText: 🧸 Encourage older babies to choose what they want to touch. You can even let them sit in or next to a basket with the objects and explore freely.
text: 🧸 Gqugquzela izingane esezikhulile ukuthi zikhethe ukuthi zifuna ukuntinta ini. Ungazivumela zihlale eduzane nobhasikidi onalezizinto bese ziyahlola ngokukhululeka.

SourceText: This sensory activity helps develop touch, language, and curiosity - and it’s perfect for quiet bonding time ⭐
text: Lomsebenzi wezinzwana usiza ukuthuthukisa ukuthinta, ulimi nelukuluku - futhi ulungele isikhathi esinokuthula sokuxhumana ⭐

SourceText: *Playtime with Books*
text: *Isikhathi Sokudlala Ngezincwadi*

SourceText: Reading to your baby from birth is a beautiful way to bond and support their development - even before they understand the words 📖
text: Ukufundela ingane kusukela izelwe yindlela enhle yokuxhumana nokuseka ukukhula kwayo - nangaphambi kokuthi bawaqonde amagama 📖

SourceText: ⏰ Choose a quiet moment, turn off distractions like TV and phones, and pick a baby-friendly book or even an old magazine or newspaper you have lying around!
text: ⏰ Khetha isikhathi esinokuthula, cisha konke okungaphazamisa njenge TV namafoni, bese ukhetha incwadi eyintandokazi yengane yakho noma iphephandaba elikhona ekhaya!

SourceText: 💚 Talk about the pictures, make sounds, and repeat simple words. Your baby will love hearing your voice - even if they don’t understand yet.
text: 💚 Xoxani ngezithombe, nenze umisindo, futhi niphindaphinde amagama alula. Ingane yakho izokuthokozela ukuzwa iphimbo lakho - noma bengakaqondi okwamanje.

SourceText: Follow their lead - if they lose interest, that’s okay. Keep it short and fun! 😃
text: Landela ukuhola kwabo - uma kwenzeka belahlekelwa umdlandla, kulungile. Kwenze kube kufishane futhi kujabulisa! 😃

SourceText: 🔄 If possible, start a regular routine to read together when your child isn’t too tired or hungry.Reading together for a few minutes a day is one of the best ways to help your child learn words and connect with you!
text: 🔄 Uma kungenzeka, qala wenze kube yinjwayelo ukufunda ndawonye uma ingane yakho ingakhathele kakhulu noma ingalambile. Ukufunda ndawonye imizuzu embalwa ngosuku indlela enhle yokusiza ingane ukufunda amagama nokuxhumana nawe!

SourceText: *Act Out Emotions*
text: *Lingisa imizwa*

SourceText: Let’s have some fun expressing feelings! 😃
text: Ake sizijabulise ngokuveza imizwa! 😃

SourceText: 👀 Tell your child, “Let’s see what it looks like when I am happy!”. Act out a happy face and name the emotion again.
text: 👀 Tshela ingane yakho, "Ake sibone kubukeka kanjani uma ngijabule!" Lingisa ubuso obujabulile uphinde usho umuzwa.

SourceText: 😔 Then try other emotions, like angry, sad, or surprised. Using a gentle voice, you can explain different reasons why you are feeling that emotion.
text: 😔 Bese uzama eminye imizwa, njengokuthukuthela, ukudangala noma ukumangala. Ungakhuluma ngezwi eliphansi uchaza izizathu ezehlukene ukuthi kungani uzizwa ngaloluhlobo.

SourceText: This isn’t just a game - it’s a chance for your child to learn how to recognize emotions in others 💚
text: Akusiwo umdlalo nje lona - ithuba lokuthi ingane yakho ifunde ukuqaphela imizwa kwabanye abantu 💚

SourceText: By understanding facial expressions, they’ll strengthen their connections with others and develop empathy 💛
text: Ngokuqonda inkulumo yobuso, bazoqinisa ukuxhumana nabanye babe nozwelo 💛

SourceText: So, get ready to act out some emotions and enjoy this special play activity together! 🌈
text: Zilungiselele ukulingisa eminye imizwa futhi ukuthokozele ukudlala okukhethekile ndawonye! 🌈

SourceText: Adapted from I am Safe, Loved, and Learning by Save the Children
text: Iguqulwe kusuka ku Ngiphephile, Ngithandiwe nesifundo sakwa Save the Children

SourceText: *Animal Sounds & Moves*
text: *Imisindo yezilwane neminyakazo*

SourceText: Let’s roar like a lion or flap like a bird! ⭐
text: Ake sibhonge njengebhubesi noma sinyakazise amaphiko njengenyoni! ⭐

SourceText: 📖 Show your baby a soft animal toy or picture and say its name: “This is a lion - roooar!”
text: 📖 Khombisa ingane yakho ithoyizi elithambile lesilwanyana noma isithombe bese usisho igama laso. "Leli ibhubesi - bhonga!"

SourceText: 🌱 For younger babies, act it out during tummy time. Older babies might copy your sounds or movements.
text: 🌱 Okwezingane ezincane, lingisa ngesikhathi sokulala ngesisu. Izingane esezikhulile zona zingakopela imisindo neminyakazo.

SourceText: 👂 Talk to your baby as you play: “The cow says moo!” Pause and wait for their reaction, even a smile or babble.
text: 👂 Khuluma nengane ngesikhathi nidlala: "Inkomo ithi moo!" Ima ulinde ukuthi izokwenza njani, izomamatheka noma ibhibhidle.

SourceText: This gentle game builds language, movement, and bonding – one animal at a time! 💛
text: Lo mdlalo onesizotha usiza ukwakha ulimi, umnyakazo nokuxhumana - isilwane esisodwa ngesikhathi! 💛

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/act-like-an-animal
text: Iguqulwe kusukela ku Ukufunda ngokudlala: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/act-like-an-animal

SourceText: *Rolling Ball Fun*
text: *Injabulo yeBhola Eligingqikayo*

SourceText: Time for a rolling game! 🔵
text: Isikhathi somdlalo wokugingqika! 🔵

SourceText: 👋 Sit facing your child and gently roll a soft ball (or something else round) back and forth between you. Say their name as you pass it: “Here it comes, Sisi!”
text: 👋 Hlala ubhekane nengane yakho, bese ugingqa ibhola elithambile kancane (noma yini eseduzane) uligingqele ngakuye naye aligingqele kuwena. Isho igama lakhe ngesikhathi ugingqela ngakuyena, "Nali liza sisi"!

SourceText: 💛 Cheer them on as they roll it back to you. You can even add a song or count the rolls out loud.
text: 💛 Yijabulele ngesikhathi eligingqela ngakuwe. Ungaqala iculo noma ubale ngephimbo eliphezu ukuthi ligingqika kangakhi.

SourceText: This fun and easy game helps your toddler practise turn-taking, hand-eye coordination, and early social skills - all while enjoying playful connection 🎈
text: Lomdlalo omnandi nolula usiza ingane yakho encane ukuphrakthiza ukushintshana, ukuhambisana kwezandla namehlo, ukuxhumana nabantu ngokushesha - konke lokhu ngesikhathi sokuxhumana ngokudlala 🎈

SourceText: *Cup Stack Challenge*
text: *Inselelo Yokupakisha Izinkomishi*

SourceText: 🍚 Grab some plastic cups or small containers and show your child how to stack them one by one.
text: 🍚 Thatha izinkomishi zapulastikhi noma okungamakhonteyina amancane, bese ubonisa ingane yakho ukuthi usenza kanjani isitaki ngokubeka inkomishi ngayinye ngayinye.

SourceText: ⬆️ How high can you build your tower?
text: ⬆️ Ungawakha ube mude kangakanani umbhoshongo wakho?

SourceText: 🎉 Knocking it down is just as fun - watch it fall, then build again!
text: 🎉 Ukuwushaya phansi nakho kumnandi - ubukele uwa, bese uyawakha futhi!

SourceText: This playful activity supports fine motor skills, concentration, and problem-solving - and your child will love seeing what happens each time they try 💡
text: Lomdlalo omnandi weseka ekukhulisa ikhono lokusebenzisa umqondo ekulawuleni ukusebenza kwezitho zomzimba ezincane (izandla, iminwe, ulimu...), ukugxila nokusombulula izinkinga - kanti futhi ingane ingathanda ukubona ukuthi kwenzakalani njalo uma izamile 💡

SourceText: *Dance Mirror*
text: *Isibuko Somdanso*

SourceText: Let’s get moving and dancing together! ⭐
text: Masinyakaze futhi sidanse ndawonye! ⭐

SourceText: 👋 Turn on some music or sing a song, and start copying your child’s moves - if they clap, you clap! If they wiggle, you wiggle!
text: 👋 Dlala umculo noma ucule ingoma, bese uqala ukopele umnyakazo wengane yakho - uma eshaya izandla nawe ushaya izandla! uma bezinyakazisa nawe uyazinyakazisa!

SourceText: 👀 Then switch and see if they’ll follow your moves.
text: 👀 Bese niyashintshana ubone ukuthi uzoyilandela yin na iminyakazo yakho.

SourceText: This back-and-forth dance helps build confidence, strengthens your bond, and supports early communication skills.
text: Lomdanso wokushintshana usiza ukwakha ukuzethemba, uqinisa ubudlelwane benu, nokweseka amakhono okukhulumisana.

SourceText: It’s a joyful, silly way to connect through rhythm, music, and play 💚
text: Kuyajabulisa ukuxhumana ngokusebenzisa isigqi, umculo, nomdlalo 💚

SourceText: *Guess the Animal*
text: *Qagela Isilwane*

SourceText: Let’s guess the animal! 🧸
text: Masiqagele isilwane! 🧸

SourceText: 👂 Make a sound like a cow (“moo!”) or a dog (“woof!”) and ask your child, “Which animal is that?”
text: 👂 Yenza umsindo njengenkomo ("moo!") noma inja ("woof!") bese ubuza ingane yakho, "Isiphi lesosilwane?"

SourceText: ⭐ You can point out animals you see, use toys, or just act it out yourself!
text: ⭐Ungakhomba izilwane ozibonayo, sebenzisa amathoyizi, noma ulingise!

SourceText: 👀 Then switch and ask them to make the noise - you’ll be surprised how many they know.
text: 👀 Bese niyashintshana ucele yona ukuthi yenze umsindo - uzomangala ukubona ukuthi wazi eziningi kangakanani.

SourceText: This fun game builds memory, language skills, and listening - all through the power of play and imagination ✅
text: Lomdlalo omnandi wakha inkumbulo, amakhono okukhuluma, nokulalela - konke lokhu kungamandla okudlala nomcabango ✅

SourceText: *Tap & Shake Band*
text: *Ibhande lokuthinta futhi unyakazise*

SourceText: Get ready to make some noise! 🔔
text: Zilungiselele ukwenza umsindo! 🔔

SourceText: 🍚 Gather safe household items - pots, plastic containers, spoons, or sealed bottles with rice or beans.
text: 🍚 Qoqa izinto zasendlini eziphephile - amabhodwe, amakhonteyina aplastikhi, izipuni, amabhodlela avaliwe anerayisi noma ubhontshisi.

SourceText: 👋Show your toddler how to tap, shake, and bang them together to create sounds.
text: 👋 Khombisa ingane yakho encane ukuthi kuthintwa kanjani, ukushukuza nokushayanisa ndawonye ukwakha umsindo.

SourceText: 🎵 Now, make some music and form your own little band! You can sing along or try repeating rhythms together.
text: 🎵 Manje yenza umculo kulebhendi yakho encane! Ungacula nayo noma uzame ukuphindaphinda isigqi ndawonye.

SourceText: This activity builds motor skills, rhythm, and listening skills, and gives your toddler a chance to express themselves through sound and movement! ✨
text: Lomsebenzi wakha amakhono okusebenza komqondo ngokuhambiza nokusebenzisa izitho somzimba ezincane (izandla, iminwe, amehlo...), isigqi, namakhono okulalela, futhi kunikeza ingane yakho encane ithuba lokuzichaza isebenzisa isigqi nomnyakazo ✨

SourceText: Adapted from UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ha943LSPtTY
text: Iguqulwe kwibhokisi lokudlala lakwa UNICEF: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ha943LSPtTY

SourceText: *Where Did It Go*
text: *Ishonephi*

SourceText: Time for a little mystery! 🎁
text: Isikhathi semfihlakalo encane! 🎁

SourceText: 🧸 Hide a small toy under a soft cloth or behind your back and ask, “Where did it go?”
text: 🧸 Fihla ithoyizi elincane ngaphansi kwendwangu noma ngemuva kwakho bese uyabuza, "Lishonephi?"

SourceText: 👀 Watch your child pull the cloth away or crawl over to investigate.
text: 👀 Bukela ingane yakho idonsa indwangu noma ikhasela ngalapho iyophenya.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns hiding and finding different objects together!
text: 🔄 Shintshanani ngokufihla nokuthola izinto ezahlukene ndawonye!

SourceText: This game helps your toddler develop memory, curiosity, and helps them understand that things still exist even when they’re out of sight! 💡
text: Lomdlalo usiza ingane yakho encane ukuthuthukisa inkumbulo, ilukuluku futhi iyisiza ekutheni iqonde ukuthi izinto zisekhona noma zingekho phambi kwamehlo ayo! 💡

SourceText: *Lap Rhyme Bounce*
text: *Iculo ugxumisa*

SourceText: 🧸 Sit your baby gently on your lap and bounce them up and down while chanting a simple rhyme you remember from childhood.
text: 🧸 Hlalisa ingane yakho ethangeni lakho bese uyigxumisa phezulu naphansi ngalesoskhathi ube ucula umlolozelo owukhumbulayo usaseyingane.

SourceText: 😃You can speed up or slow down the bounce for extra fun. Add facial expressions or tickles for extra giggles!
text: 😃 Ungakusheshisa noma ukwenze kancane ukumgxumisa ukwengeza ubumnandi. Fakela nokunyakazisa ubuso noma ukumkitaza ukuze agigitheke!

SourceText: This rhythmic lap game builds bonding, listening, and body awareness - just like caregivers have done with little ones for generations 💙
text: Lomlolozelo wasethangeni wakha ubudlelwane, ukulalela nokuqonda umzimba - njengabazali benzile ezinganeni zabo eminyakeni eminingi edlule 💙

SourceText: *Shadow Play*
text: *Umdlalo wesithunzi*

SourceText: Step into a world of imagination and light with this exciting activity! 🌙
text: Ngena emhlabeni womfanekiso-ngqondweni nokukhanya ngamsebenzi othakazelekayo! 🌙

SourceText: 💡 In a darkened room, grab a light and shine it at your hand, casting fun shadows onto the wall.
text: 💡Endlini emnyama, thatha ilambu ulikhanyisele esandleni sakho, bese wenza izithunzi zesandla obondeni.

SourceText: 👋 Wave at your child and create silly shapes with your fingers - maybe a bunny, a bird, or whatever your imagination dreams up!
text: 👋 Valelisa enganeni wenze imifanekiso ehlekisayo ngeminwe yakho - mhlawumbe unogwaja, inyoni noma ikuphi okufika emcabangweni!

SourceText: 👀 Watch as their curiosity grows, and invite them to try waving their shadow hand back.
text: 👀 Buka ilukuluku layo likhula, yimeme ukuthi izame ukuvalelisa ngesandla sayo.

SourceText: 🔑 Encourage your little one to take a turn with the flashlight, giving them the thrill of seeing how light can create different shapes and movements on the wall.
text: 🔑 Gqugquzela ingane yakho ukuthi nayo ithathe ilambu, ithole injabulo yokubona ukuthi ilambu liyakwazi ukwakha imifanekiso neminyakazo odongeni.

SourceText: 🏁 Older children might want to join in the fun and make a shadow animal of their own!
text: 🏁 Izingane ezindala zingafisa ukujoyina ukwenza isithunzi sesilwane ngokwabo!

SourceText: This practical experience helps them understand cause and effect, and boosts their creativity and focus as they make shadows ✅
text: Lelithuba lokwenza lizisiza ekutheni ziqonde umsuka nomphumela, futhi kukhuphula ubuhlakani babo nokugxila uma benza isithunzi ✅

SourceText: Adapted from Zero To Three: https://www.zerotothree.org/resource/play-activities-for-12-to-24-months/
text: Iguqulwe kukususelwa ku- Zero To Three: https://www.zerotothree.org/resource/play-activities-for-12-to-24-months/

SourceText: *Mini Obstacle Race*
text: *Umjaho omncane wezithiyo*

SourceText: Get ready to set up an exciting adventure right in your home! 🚩
text: Zilungiselele uhambo olujabulisayo khona ekhaya lakho 🚩

SourceText: 🔶 Using pillows, chairs, and blankets, create a fun and safe obstacle race for your toddler to explore.
text: 🔶 Usebenzisa imicamelo, izihlalo nezingubo zokulala, kwenza ubumnandi nomjaho wezithiyo ophephile ukuze ingane yakho encane ihlole.

SourceText: 👋 The goal? For your little one to navigate the course by crawling, jumping, and climbing over, under, and through the obstacles.
text: 👋 Inhloso? Okwengane yakho ukuzitholela isifundo ngokukhasa, ukugxuma, nokugibela phezulu, ngaphansi nokudlula kwizithiyo.

SourceText: 💡 As they tackle each challenge, they’ll be developing important gross motor skills like coordination, balance, and strength.
text: 💡 Njengoba bedlula kwizithiyo, bazithuthukisa ngokwenza iminyakazo emikhulu njengokuxhumanisa, ukubhalansa namandla

SourceText: 💛Not only will this activity get them moving, but it will also boost their confidence as they conquer each part of the race.
text: 💛 Lomsebenzi aungcini nje ngokubenza banyakazise umziba, kepha udlondlobalisa ukuzethmba kathi benqoba isithiyo ngasinye salomjaho.

SourceText: It’s an easy, playful way to promote physical development while having a great time together! Let the obstacle adventure begin! 🎉
text: Kuyindlela elula, indlela enomdlalo yokhuthaza ukukhula komzimba ngesikhathi nichitha isikhathi esimnandi ndawonye! Mawuqale ke umjaho! 🎉

SourceText: Adapted from Zero To Three: https://www.zerotothree.org/resource/10-olympian-inspired-activity-ideas-for-toddlers/
text: Iguqulwe kususelwa ku- Zero To Three: https://www.zerotothree.org/resource/10-olympian-inspired-activity-ideas-for-toddlers/

SourceText: *Categorising and Organising*
text: *Ukuhlukanisa Nokuhlela*

SourceText: Help your child to learn by sorting objects and things! 🔵🔷
text: Siza ingane yakho ekutheni ifunde ngokuhlukanisa izinto! 🔵🔷

SourceText: By grouping items like a bear as an animal or a mango as a fruit, they’ll start to understand how different things fit together. 🧸
text: Ukuqhlela izinto njengesilwane i-bear noma umango njengesithelo, uzoqala ukuqonda ukuthi izinto zixhumana kanjani. 🧸

SourceText: At home, find safe objects and let them sort them by colour, size, or type - plastic cups and plates are perfect for this!
text: Thola izinto eziphephile ekhaya ubayekele bahlunge ngokwemibala, ubukhulu noma uhlobo - izinkomishi namapuleti aplastikhi akulungele lokhu!

SourceText: Want to make it more interesting? Try sorting pots and pans by size: Can they fit the small pans into the larger ones? ☕
text: Ufuna ukuyenza ibe ithakazelise kakhulu? Zama ukuhlunga amabhodwe namapani ngobukhulu: Bangakwazi ukufaka amancane kwamakhulu? ☕

SourceText: If you are outside, name different kinds of vehicles on the street or things you see in nature like stones, sticks, trees and flowers. 🌷
text: Uma ungaphandle isho izinhlobo zezimoto ezisemgaqweni nezinto eziyimvelo ozibonayo njengamatshe, izinkuni, izihlahla nezimbali. 🌷

SourceText: 🔄 You can play the categorising game anywhere! Just look around and ask your child to find things from the category you say!
text: 🔄 Ningadlala lomdlalo wokuhlukanisa noma ikuphi! Buka eduzane bese utshela ingane yakho ukuthi ithole izinto kwisigaba osishoyo!

SourceText: Sorting and grouping builds thinking skills, memory, and early logic -helping your child make sense of the world around them through playful discovery 🌈
text: Ukuhlunga kwakha ikhono lokucabaga, inkumbulo nokwazi ukucabanga ngokushesha okusiza ingane yakho ikwazi ukuqonda okwenzakalayo emhlabeni oyizungezile ngokudlala 🌈

SourceText: Adapted from Brain Building Through Play by Harvard University: https://developingchild.harvard.edu/resources/brainbuildingthroughplay/
text: Iguqulwe isuselwa ku- Brain Building Through Play ngabase Havard University: https://developingchild.harvard.edu/resources/brainbuildingthroughplay/

SourceText: *Shapes Everywhere!*
text: *Amasheyiphu Yonke Indawo!*

SourceText: 📺 Squares, squares everywhere
text: 📺 Izikwele, izikwele yonke indawo

SourceText: 👀 Draw squares in the sand or dirt. Make some bigger and some smaller.
text: 👀 Dweba izikwele emhlabathini. Yenza ezinye zibe nkulu, ezinye zibe ncane.

SourceText: Tell @fields.child_nickname, “this is a square.”
text: Tshela u@fields.child_nickname, “lesi isikwele.”
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Ask your child to try to draw a square. Hold your child’s hand to help if this is hard.
text: Cela ingane yakho ukuthi idwebe isikwele. Bamba isandla sengane yakho ukuyisiza uma lokhu kunzima.

SourceText: Look for things around the home or outdoors that are the same shape.
text: Funa izinto endlini noma ngaphandle ezinesheyiphu efanayo.

SourceText: Now do the same with circles! 🔴
text: Manje yenza okufanayo ngezindlingilizi! 🔴

SourceText: Tell your child, “this is a square.”
text: Tshela ingane yakho, "lesi isikwele."

SourceText: This simple shape game builds early maths skills, observation, and coordination - right from the start! ✅
text: Lomdlalo olula wamasheyiphu wakha ikhono lokubala ingane isencane, ukubuka nokuxhumanisa - kusukela ekuqaleni! ✅

SourceText: *Active Songs*
text: *Izingoma Ezinomdlandla*

SourceText: Young children love to move - and songs with actions make it even more fun! Singing gives your child cues for how and when to move 🎵
text: Izingane ezincane ziyakuthanda ukunyakaza - izingoma ezineminyakazo zenza kube mnandi kakhulu. Ukucula kusiza ingane yazi ukuthi kunyakazwa nini uma kuculwa 🎵

SourceText: Movement songs build listening skills, self-control, and rhythm - while helping your child learn to follow instructions!
text: Izingoma ezinomnyakazo zakha ikhono lokulalela, ukuzithiba nesigqi - ngenkathi usiza ingane yakho ukulandela imiyalelo!

SourceText: Sing songs to @fields.child_nickname or a group of children in which they have to:
text: Mculele u-@fields.child_nickname noma kwiqembu lezingane lapho bona kumele ba:
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: ✅ Start and stop ❌
text: ✅ Qale bese bayama ❌

SourceText: ⬇️ Slow down and speed up ⬆️
text: ⬇️ Zehlise ziphinde zenyuse isipidi ⬆️

SourceText: Some song ideas:- “If you’re happy and you know it”- “Heads, shoulders, knees and toes”- “Freeze dance” (play or sing music and freeze when it stops!)- “Sleeping bunnies” (sleep, then hop!)
text: Eminye imiqondo ngamaculo: - "Uma uzazi ukuthi ujabule futhi uyakwazi lokho" - "Khanda, mahlombe, madolo nezinzwane"- Nokudansa nokuma" (dlala umculo noma ucule, uma umculo uthula uyama unganyakazi)" - Onogwaja abalele ( lala, bese ugxuma gxume!)

SourceText: Sing songs to your child or a group of children in which they have to:
text: Culela ingane yakho ingoma noma kwiqembu lezingane bona ekumele ba:

SourceText: *Be the Narrator*
text: *Iba Ngumxoxi*

SourceText: 👀 Say what your child is doing while they are playing.
text: 👀 Yisho okwenziwa yingane yakho ngesikhathi idlala.

SourceText: 👂 This will help them learn the words to describe their actions.
text: 👂 Lokhu kuzoyisiza ekufundeni amagama okuchaza izenzo zayo.

SourceText: 😃 You can do it in a simple way, or in a silly way like a sports commentator, a news presenter, or a game show host.
text: 😃 Ungakwenza lokhu ngendlela elula, noma esamahlaya njengomethuli wezemidlalo, umethuli wezindaba, noma umphathi wohlelo lomdlalo.

SourceText: 💡 Ask questions like “What will you do next?” or “I see you want to put the ball in the jar. Is there another way to do that?”
text: 💡 Buza imibuzo njengokuthi "yini elandelayo ozoyenza?" noma "Ngiyabona ufuna ukufaka ibhola kujeke. Ikhona yini enye indlela yokwenza lokho?"

SourceText: *Be an Artist!*
text: *Iba Usomaciko!*

SourceText: 📝 Give @fields.child_nickname some paper and a pen or pencil, or some different pens or pencils.
text: 📝 Nikeza u@fields.child_nickname iphepha nepeni noma ipensela, noma amapeni ahlukene namapensela.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 😃 Let your child draw whatever they want to!
text: 😃 Vumela ingane yakho idwebe noma yini ayifunayo!

SourceText: 👀 Ask questions about what they are drawing, the size of the thing they are drawing, and the colours they are using.
text: 👀 Buza imibuzo ngento eyidwebayo, usayizi bento eyidwebayo, nemibala eyisebenzisayo.

SourceText: 🏆 If possible, put your child’s picture up on the wall when they are finished. Give praise to your child!
text: 🏆 Uma kwenzeka, beka isithombe sengane yakho odongeni uma iqeda. Income ingane yakho!

SourceText: 📝 Give your child some paper and a pen or pencil, or some different pens or pencils.
text: 📝 Nikeza ingane yakho iphepha nepeni noma ipensela, noma amapeni ahlukene namapensela.

SourceText: This open drawing time builds imagination, fine motor skills, and confidence - especially when you celebrate their creations! 🎉
text: Lesi sikhathi esivulelekile sokudweba sakha imicabango, amakhono okuzenzela izinto - kakhulukazi uma ujabulelela ubuhlakani bayo 🎉

SourceText: *Echo Songs*
text: *Amaculo lapho kukhona oqalayo bese wonke umuntu elandela esho lokhu okushiwo oqalile*

SourceText: 😃 Try a simple call-and-response chant with your child. You say a line, and they copy it back.
text: 😃 Zama iculo elilula lapho kukhona oqalayo nengane yakho. Usho ulayini owodwa bese yona iyakopela ngokusho lokhu okushilo.

SourceText: 👂 For example:
text: 👂 Ngokwesibonelo:

SourceText: You: “Hello there!”
text: Wena: Sawubona!

SourceText: Child: “Hello there!”
text: Ingane: "Sawubona!"

SourceText: You: “How are you?”
text: Wena: "Unjani?"

SourceText: Child: “How are you?”
text: Ingane: 'Unjani?"?

SourceText: 💚 Use your own words and language.
text: 💚 Sebenzisa amagama akho nolimi.

SourceText: These traditional-style echo songs build turn-taking, memory, and early conversation skills - all through playful singing 🎵
text: Lezingoma zesintu lapho kuqala omunye, omunye aphinde okushiwo zakha ukushintshana, inkumbulo, nokuxhumana ngengxoxo ingane isencane - konke lokhu ngomdlalo wokuhlabelela 🎵

SourceText: *Circle Clap and Dance*
text: *Ukushaywa kwezandla nomdanso kwisikokela*

SourceText: 👋 Gather a few children (or just you and your little one) and form a small circle.
text: 👋 Qoqa izingane ezimbalwa (noma kube nguwe nengane yakho encane) nenze isikokela esincane.

SourceText: 🎵 Clap your hands in rhythm and sing a well-known local song like: “Shosholoza… ku lezontaba…”
text: 🎵 Shaya izandla ngesigqi futhi ucule ingoma edumile endaweni elinjengaleli elithi "Shosgoloza..... ku lezontaba"

SourceText: ⭐ As the song plays, take turns dancing into the centre of the circle or copying each other’s moves. Children can jump, spin, or stomp to the beat!
text: ⭐ Ngesikhathi ingoma idlala, shintshanani ngokudansa esiphakathini sesikokela, ningakopela iminyakazo yabanye. Izingane zingagxuma, zisipine noma zigidele ingoma!

SourceText: This joyful game builds social confidence, movement skills, and musical rhythm - all while connecting to culture 💛
text: Lomdlalo omnandi wakha ukuzethemba, amakhono omnyakazo nesigqi somculo - ngenkathi konke kuxhumana namasiko 💛

SourceText: *One-on-One Time*
text: *Isikhathi Ninobabili Nodwa*

SourceText: 💚 Spending time just with your child and taking an interest in them can improve your relationship.
text: 💚 Ukuchitha isikhathi nengane yakho nokuyikhathalela kungathuthukisa ubudlelwane benu.

SourceText: 👀 When your child is playing alone or occupying themselves quietly, join them and show interest in what they are doing.
text: 👀 Uma ingane yakho idlala yodwa noma iba matasa ngokuthula. mujoyine ukhombise ukuba nendaba kulokhu akwenzayo.

SourceText: 👂Ask questions about their activity, and listen to them.
text: 👂 Buza imibuzo ngomsebenzi awenzayo, bese uyalalela.

SourceText: Let your child lead the activity, follow them to build their confidence and autonomy 😃.
text: Dedela ingane yakho ihole umsebenzi. mulandele ukwakha ukuzethemba nokuzimela 😃

SourceText: 👀 Say what you see - describing everything and supporting your child’s actions.
text: 👀 Isho okubonayo - chaza konke futhi weseke izenzo zengane yakho.

SourceText: Be positive, praise your child, and enjoy spending this time with them 😃💚
text: Yiba sesimweni esihle, ncoma ingane yakho futhi ujabulele ukuchitha isikhathi naye 😃💚

SourceText: 📖 Book sharing will help your child learn and is a fun, playful activity to spend quality time together.
text: 📖 Ukwabelana ngencwadi kuzosiza ingane yakho ngokufunda futhi yindlela engumdlalo ojabulisayo ukuchitha isikhathi esibalulekile ndawonye.

SourceText: ⏰ Choose a time when you won’t be disturbed, and try to stop any distractions - e.g. turn off the TV and put away phones.
text: ⏰ Khetha isikhathi eningeke niphazamiseke ngaso, futhi uvimbe iziphazamiso - isib. cima iTV futhi ubeka amafoni.

SourceText: 📖 If your child wants to choose a book, that’s fine, otherwise choose for them.
text: 📖 Uma ingane yakho ifuna ukukhetha incwadi, kulungile, noma wena uyikhethele.

SourceText: 💚 Sit close together and follow your child’s attention and lead.
text: 💚 Hlalani ngokusondelana ulandelele ukunaka ingane yakho ihola.

SourceText: Point at things, name and repeat words. Help them to learn more about what interests them in the book 👀
text: Khomba izinto, isho amagama futhi uwaphinde. Yisize ukufunda kakhulu ngezinto azinakayo encwadini 👀

SourceText: Link things in the books to your child's life, and use words about emotions and talk about them! 😃
text: Qondanisa izinto ezisencwadini nempilo yomntwana wakho, futhi usebenzise amagama mayelana nemizwa bese ukhuluma ngawo! 😃

SourceText: 🔄 If possible, start a regular routine to read together when your child isn’t too tired or hungry.
text: 🔄 Uma kwenzeka, qala uhlelo lokufunda ndawonye njalo uma ingane yakho ingakhathele kakhulu noma ingalambile.

SourceText: Reading together is one of the best ways to help your child learn and prepare for success in school! 🎓
text: Ukufunda ndawonye indlela engcono yokusiza ingane yakho ekufundeni nokulungiselela ukuphumelela esikoleni! 🎓

SourceText: 💚 Sit close together and follow your child's attention and lead.
text: 💚 Hlalani ngokusondelana bese ulandelela lapho ingane yakho inake khonza nkathi ihola.

SourceText: If there are words or numbers in the book, ask and help your child recognise letters numbers, and simple words 💡.
text: Uma kukhona amagama noma izinombolo encwadini, buza futhi usize ingane yakho ukubona ama-alfabethi, izinombolo namagama alula 💡.

SourceText: Link things in the books to your child's life, and use words about emotions and talk about them! 😃.
text: Qondanisa izinto encwadini nempilo yomntwana wakho, futhi usebenzise amagama emizwa bese ukhuluma ngawo! 😃.

SourceText: *Animal Acting*
text: *Ukulingisa isilwane*

SourceText: Get ready to roar like a lion or hop like a kangaroo! 🧸
text: Lungela ukubhonga njengebhubesi noma ukugxuma njenge kangaroo! 🧸

SourceText: 📝 To start, write the names of animals on small pieces of paper and put them in a box or container.
text: 📝 Qala ngokubhala amagama ezilwane kwiziqeshana zamaphepha uwafake ebhokisini noma esitsheni.

SourceText: 👋 Take turns picking a piece of paper and acting out the animal - can you mimic its sounds and movements? Roar, jump, crawl, or fly just like the animal you picked!
text: 👋 Shintshanani ngokucosha iphepha bese nilingisela leso silwane - Ungakwazi ukulingisela umsindo nomnyakazo waso? Ukubhonga, ukugxuma, ukukhasa noma ukundiza njengaleso silwane osikhethile!

SourceText: 🎉 For older kids, turn it into a fun guessing game - see if others can guess which animal you’re pretending to be!
text: 🎉 Izingane esezikhulile, zingawenza kube umdlalo omnandi wokuqagela - bona ukuthi nabanye bangakwazi ukuqagela isilwane osilingisayo!

SourceText: This active game helps kids develop physical skills while also supporting speech and language development in a fun way 💚
text: Lomdlalo onomnyakazo usiza izingane ekuthuthukiseni amakhono omzimba, ngalesosikhathi weseka ukuthuthukisa ulimi nokukhuluma ngendlela emnandi 💚

SourceText: *Freeze Dance*
text: *Umdanso wokuma unganyakazi*

SourceText: Get ready to dance and freeze with this exciting activity that toddlers love! 🎵
text: Lungela ukudansa bese uyama unganyakazi ngalomsebenzi ojabulisayo othandwa izingane ezincane! 🎵

SourceText: 📻 Play some music and let your child dance or move however they like.
text: 📻 Dlala umculo bese uyekela ingane yakho idanse noma inyakaze ngendlela ethanda ngayo.

SourceText: ⏸ When the music stops, tell them to freeze – to not move at all! – in one place.
text: ⏸ Uma umculo uthula, itshele ime inganyakazi - inganyakazi nhlobo! - ime endaweni eyodwa.

SourceText: This fun game is great for building listening skills and self-control as they practise stopping and starting ✨
text: Lomdlalo ojabulisayo muhle ukwakheni amakhono okulalela nokuzithiba ngenkathi bephrakthiza ukuma nokuqala ✨

SourceText: It’s also a wonderful way to prepare for school, where they’ll need to follow directions 🔑
text: Kuyindlela enhle ukulungiselela isikole, uma sekudingeka ukulandela umkhombandlela 🔑

SourceText: So, turn up the music and enjoy the dancing – and the freezing! 💚
text: Khuphula umsindo womculo uthokozele ukudansa - nokuma! 💚

SourceText: *Mystery Bag*
text: *Isikhwama Semfihlakalo*

SourceText: This game is easy and perfect for engaging your toddler’s senses and learning new words 🎁
text: Lomdlalo ulula futhi ukulungele ukuxhumisa imizwa yengane yakho encane nokufunda amagama amasha 🎁

SourceText: 🏆 Simply place different objects into a bag and ask your child to reach in, feel an item, and guess what it is before pulling it out.
text: 🏆 Faka izinto ezihlukene esikhwameni bese ucela ingane yakho ukuthi ifake isandla, ezwe izinto, bese iqagela ukuthi yini ngaphambi kokuyikhipha.

SourceText: 👋 When they pull out the item, ask them questions to describe what they see: Is it smooth or scary? Bumpy or bright?
text: 👋 Uma ikhipha okungaphakathi, yibuze imibuzo ichaze ekubonayo: Ingabe kubushelelezi noma kuyathusa? Kunamabhamp noma kuqhakazile?

SourceText: It’s a fun way to introduce new words and stimulate their sense of touch! 💡
text: Kuyindlela ejabulisayo yokuveza amagama amasha nokuvuselela umuzwa wakhe wokuthinta! 💡

SourceText: Benefits of this activity include expanding vocabulary, developing tactile senses, and practising grouping skills. It’s a wonderful way to mix fun with learning! 🎉
text: Inzuzo enhle yalomsebenzi ifaka ukwandisa amagama asetshenziswayo, ukukhulisa izinzwana nokuphrakhthiza amakhono okuhlanganisa ngamaqoqo. Kuyindlela enhle yokuhlanganisa injabulo nokufunda! 🎉

SourceText: Adapted from British Council: https://learnenglishkids.britishcouncil.org/parents/top-tips/mystery-bag-game
text: Iguqulwe kususelwa ku- British Council: https://learnenglishkids.britishcouncil.org/parents/top-tips/mystery-bag-game

SourceText: *Body Outline*
text: *Amalungu Omzimba*

SourceText: This fun and interactive game helps your toddler learn about different parts of the body 🧸
text: Lomdlalo ojabulisayo usiza ingane yakho encane ukufunda ngamalungu omzimba ahlukene 🧸

SourceText: 📝 Start by drawing their body outline on a large piece of paper or with a stick on the ground.
text: 📝 Qala ngokudweba amalungu omzimba ephepheni elikhulu noma ngothi emhlabathini.

SourceText: 👂 As you go, ask them to point to and name different body parts. For example, you can say, “Where’s your nose?” or “Can you point to your feet?”
text: 👂 Usaqhubeka yicele ukuthi ikhombe futhi isho amagama amalungu omzimba. Isibonelo, ungathi, "Liphi ikhala lakho? noma " Ungazikhomba izinyawo zakho?"

SourceText: 👋As they point, encourage them to name each part.
text: 👋 Ngenkthi ikhomba, yigqugquzele ukuthi ilisho ngegama ilungu ngalinye.

SourceText: 🎨 When you are done, you can colour in the outline or decorate it with anything you have in or around the house to make it more creative and engaging!
text: 🎨 Uma seniqedile, ningafaka umbala nisihlobise isithombe nanoma ingani onayo endlini ukusenza sibukeke kahle futhi sihehe!

SourceText: This fun and creative activity helps your child improve their body awareness, learn new words, and develop fine motor skills 💡
text: Lomdlalo onobuhlakani usiza ingane ukukhuliseni ukuqaphela umzimba wayo, ukufunda amagama amasha, nokufunda amakhono okusebenzisa umqondo amalungu amancane omzimba 💡

SourceText: *Paper Ball Game*
text: *Umdlalo Webhola Lephepha*

SourceText: Get ready to practice your child’s aim and physical coordination as you play with paper balls together 🔷
text: Lungela ukuphrakthiza ukuqondanisa nokuhlela ngenkathi nidlala ngebhola lephepha ndawonye 🔷

SourceText: 📝 Here’s what you’ll need: paper (to scrunch up into balls), and crayons.
text: 📝 Nakhu okudingayo: iphepha ( ulifohloze wenze ibhola), namakhrayoni.

SourceText: 🎨 Start by colouring each piece of paper so that it is a unique colour. Now scrunch up the paper until you have a paper ball.
text: 🎨 Qala ngokufaka umbala ohlukile kwiphepha ngalinye. Manje hlofoza iphepha uze ube nebhola lephepha.

SourceText: 🚩 Next, make a goal. You can use markings that already exist, or a clear table surface.
text: 🚩 Okulandelayo yenza ipali. Ungasebenzisa omaka asebevele bekhona noma itafula eliqoqiwe.

SourceText: 🏅 Now you’re ready to play! Take turns tossing your ball towards the goal. Whoever scores or lands closest to the goal wins the round!
text: 🏅 Manje senikulungele ukudlala! Shintshanani ukugingqa ibhola uyofaka igoli. Okorile uwina loyo mzuliswano!

SourceText: This fun and engaging game is perfect for boosting your child’s physical coordination and decision-making skills while keeping them entertained. Let the friendly competition begin! ⭐
text: Lomdlalo ojabulisayo ulungele ukukhulisa ikhono lokunyakazisa umzimba ngendlela efanele lokho ekwenzayo namakhono okuthatha izinqumo ngenkathi ibagcina bejabule. Awuqale umncintiswano wobungani! ⭐

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/jumping-caps
text: Iguqulwe kususelwa ku Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/jumping-caps

SourceText: *Letter in the Shop*
text: *Incwadi Esitolo*

SourceText: Turn your next trip to the store into a learning adventure! 🍞
text: Yenza indlela yenu elandelayo niya esitolo kube uhambo lokufunda 🍞

SourceText: 🍅 As you shop, pick a letter and talk about the items on your shopping list that start with that letter.
text: 🍅 Ngesikhathi uthenga esitolo khetha ialfabhethi ukhulume ngezinto ozozithenga ezikuhlu lokuthenga eziqala ngaleyo alfabhethi.

SourceText: 👀 Ask your child to find other things in the shop that start with the same letter.
text: 👀 Cela ingane yakho ukuthi ithole ezinye izinto esitolo ezinamagama aqala ngaleyo alfabhethi.

SourceText: This simple activity helps build your child’s letter recognition and vocabulary while keeping them engaged during the shopping trip ✨
text: Lomsebenzi olula usiza ukwakha ukuqaphela ama alfabhethi nolimi olusetshenziswayo ngesikhathi siyigcina iyingxenye yohambo ✨

SourceText: It’s a fun, interactive way to learn about letters and sounds in real-world situations, turning an ordinary task into an exciting educational game! 🌈
text: Kuyindlela ejabulisayo exhumanisanayo yokufunda nokuzizwa besemhlabeni wangempela, ukujika umsebenzi ojwayelekile kube umdlalo onesifundo! 🌈

SourceText: Adapted from Sesame Workshop: https://sesameworkshop.org/resources/what-will-we-do/
text: Iguqulwe ku Sesame Workshop: https://sesameworkshop.org/resources/what-will-we-do/

SourceText: *Fun with Food*
text: *Injabulo ngo Kudla*

SourceText: Cooking can help your child start learning maths!
text: Ukupheka kungasiza ingane yakho ukuqala ukufunda izibalo!

SourceText: 💚 Invite your child to help you cook for your family, or to help you prepare a colourful fruit salad.
text: 💚 Mema ingane yakho ikusize ukuphekela umndeni, noma ikusize ukulungisa isaladi lezithelo elimibalabala.

SourceText: 🍅 As you gather the ingredients, ask them to count: 'How many tomatoes do we have?' This builds maths skills and encourages teamwork.
text: 🍅 Njengoba nisaqoqa izithako, yicele abale: Bangaki otamatisi esinabo? Lokhu kwakha ikhono lezibalo futhi kugqugquzela ukusebenzisana.

SourceText: 5️⃣ Help your child to understand adding and subtracting quantities. 'We need five tomatoes, if we have three, how many more do we need?' This makes learning fun!
text: 5️⃣ Siza ingane yakho ukuqonda ukwengeza nokuphungula kokuningi. 'Sidinga otamatisi abahlanu, uba sinabathathu, bangaki abanye esibadingayo? Lokhu kwenza ukufunda kujabulise!

SourceText: 👀 Let’s make it playful! Ask, 'Which is bigger: the tomato or the onion?' This reinforces comparison skills.
text: 👀 Asikwenze kube umdlalo! Buza, 'Ikuphi okukhulu: utamatisi noma u anyanisi?' Lokhu kuqinisa amakhono okuqhathanisa.

SourceText: 🔄 Consider planning a weekly cooking night.
text: 🔄 Hlela ukwenza uhlelo lokupheka ntambama lweviki neviki.

SourceText: Cooking strengthens your relationship and builds your child’s confidence. Enjoy your cooking adventure together!
text: Ukupheka kuqinisa ubudlelwane futhi kukhulisa ukuzethemba enganeni yakho. Thokozela ukupheka ndawonye!

SourceText: Adapted from Thrive By Five: https://www.thrivebyfive.com/
text: Iguqulwe kususelwa ku Thrive By Five: https://www.thrivebyfive.com/

SourceText: *Following Instructions*
text: *Ukulandela Imiyalelo*

SourceText: 👂 Play a game in which your child listens to and tries to remember strings of instructions.
text: 👂 Dlala umdlalo lapho ingane yakho ilalela bese izama ukukhumbula imiyalelo.

SourceText: This will be useful in school, at home, and later in life!
text: Lokhu kuzosiza esikoleni, ekhaya, nasempilweni esikhathini esizayo!

SourceText: Start with just one instruction using an object in your home. For example “touch the red ball” 🔴
text: Qala ngomyalelo owodwa usebenzisa into esekhaya lakho. Isibonelo "thinta ibhola elibomvu" 🔴

SourceText: Slowly add more instructions (e.g “then pick up the cup "☕), but tell your child that they can only start once you’ve finished giving the instructions.
text: Ungangeza eminye imiyalelo kancane kancane (isbonelo" bese uthatha inkomishi"☕), bese utshela ingane yakho ukuthi ingaqala uma usuqedile ukumnika imiyalelo.

SourceText: See how many your child can follow without forgetting!
text: Bheka ukuthi ingane yakho ingalandela emingaki ngaphandle kokukhohlwa!

SourceText: 🔄 Now swap roles! It’s your child’s turn to give you instructions! They can use the same objects if they want.
text: 🔄 Manje shintshisanani! Sekuyithuba lengane yakho ukuthi ikunike imiyalelo! Ingasebenzisa izinto ezifanayo uma efuna.

SourceText: You can also try this game with a group of children! Make sure they take turns 😃
text: Ungawuzama lomdlalo neqembu lezingane! Qinisekisa ukuthi ziyashintshana 😃

SourceText: *I Spy Colours!*
text: *Ngipopola Imibala*

SourceText: 👀 Choose an object around you and say: “I spy with my little eye, something that is…” and say the colour of object, like “yellow” or “red”.
text: 👀 Khetha into eseduzane nawe bese uthi: "Ngiyapopola ngehlo lami elincane ukuthi..."usho umbala waleyonto, njengokuthi "phuzi" noma "bomvu."

SourceText: ✅ Encourage your child to look around and guess what the object might be. When they guess correctly, give them praise and switch roles!
text: ✅ Gqugquzela ingane yakho ukuthi iqalaze bese iqagela ukuthi ngabe yini leyo. Uma iqagele kahle, yincome nishintshane ngezindima!

SourceText: 🔑 If they’re having trouble, offer clues like, “It’s round” or “It’s somewhere in that corner".
text: 🔑 Uma iba nenkinga, ungayinikeza umkhondo njengokuthi, "iyindilinga" noma "ilaphaya ngasekhoneni".

SourceText: 🔄 Keep the game going with new objects and different colours.
text: 🔄 Qhubekani nomdlalo ngezinto ezintsha ezinemibala ehlukene.

SourceText: This classic game is a fun and interactive way to help your child learn words, observe, and stay concentrated. This will help them at home and in school 🏁
text: Lomdlalo onemibalabala umnandi futhi unendlela yokuxhumana esiza ingane yakho ukufunda amagama, ukuqaphela ukuhlala ugxilile. Lokhu kuzoyisiza ekhaya nasesikoleni 🏁

SourceText: *I Spy Letters!*
text: *Ngipopola izincwadi*

SourceText: 👀 I spy is a fun game to play with your child that will help them learn about letters and words!
text: 👀 Ngipopola umdlalo omnandi ongawudlala nengane yakho ezoyisiza ukufunda ama -alfabhethi namagama!

SourceText: Choose an object or a thing around you, and don’t tell your child what it is. It should be something that your child knows the word for. For example “ball” ⚽
text: Khetha into eduzane nawe, ungayitsheli ingane yakho ukuthi yini leyo. Kufanele kube into ingane yakho eyaziyo igama layo. Isibonelo "ibhola" ⚽

SourceText: 👀 Then say “I spy with my little eye, something beginning with *and then say the first letter of the word* which in this case is “b”
text: 👀 Bese uthi "Ngipopola ngehlo lami elincane, into eqala ngo *bese usho i-alfabethi yokuqala yegama* okungu "b" kulesisimo

SourceText: Your child should look around and guess what the object is. When they guess it right, praise them and swap roles! If they can’t get it, give them some clues, like “it’s round” or “it’s black and white”. ✅
text: Ingane yakho kumele ibheke eduzane bese iqagela ukuthi yini leyonto. Uma iqagele kahle, yincome bese nishintshana ngezindima! Uma ingaitholi yinike umkhondo njengokuthi "iyindilinga" noma " imnyama nokumhlophe". ✅

SourceText: Play this game with as many objects as possible and as many different letters! Help your child to learn about the different letters and sounds in words. This will help them learn to read at home and school. 🎓
text: Dlala lomdlalo ngezinto eziningi nama - alfabhethi ahlukahlukene! Siza ingane yakho ukufunda ngama - alfabhethi ahlukene nemisindo esemagameni. Lokhu kuzoyisiza ekufundeni ekhaya nasesikoleni. 🎓

SourceText: *What Letter is This?*
text: *Iyiphi le Alfabhethi?*

SourceText: Playing games with letters can help your child learn the alphabet and how letters are put together to make words.
text: Ukudlala imidlalo ngamagama kungasiza ingane yakho ukufunda ahlanganiswa kanjani ama-alfabhethi ukwakha amagama.

SourceText: 📝 Write a letter on a piece of card or paper (e.g. “p”)
text: 📝 Bhala i-alfabethi eyodwa kwibhodi noma ephepheni (isib. "p")

SourceText: 👂 Say the letter out loud and ask your child to say it too!
text: 👂 Isho i-alfabhethi kakhulu bese ucela ingane yakho isho nayo!

SourceText: Ask your child to say some words that begin with the letter “p”, give them clues like “What starts with “p”? Plant… What else? 🌱
text: Cela ingane yakho ukuthi isho amagama aqala ngo-alfabethi u-"t", yiphe umkhondo njengokuthi "Yini eqala ngo-"t"? Tshala... Yini okunye? 🌱

SourceText: 👀 Ask your child to look for objects in your house that begin with a letter (eg “p” for plate). Help them find things.
text: 👀 Cela ingane yakho ukuthi ibheke izinto endlini eziqala nge alfabhethi (isbonelo "p" we puleti). Yisize ukuthola izinto.

SourceText: 🔄 Try a new letter every day!
text: 🔄 Zama i-alfabhethi eyodwa futh entsha ngosuku!

SourceText: *Riddles Time*
text: *Isikhathi Sokuphicaphicana*

SourceText: Riddles and puzzles are a fun way to build thinking skills! 💡
text: Iziphicaphicano namaphazili ayindlela ejabulisayo yokwakha ikhono lokucabanga! 💡

SourceText: Do you remember any riddles from your childhood? If you can’t then make one up, they can be very simple! 😃
text: Uyazikhumbula iziphicaphicana zasebuntwaneni bakho? Uma uhluleka, yakha eyodwa, ingaba lula kakhulu! 😃

SourceText: Like “What can you see at night but not in the day” Answer: “The moon” 🌙
text: Njengokuthi "Yini ongayibona ebusuku kodwa ayiveli emini" Impendulo: "Inyanga" 🌙

SourceText: If your child is finding them difficult, try an easy one like: “What is round, bouncy and can be thrown or kicked?” Answer: “A ball” ⚽
text: Uma ingane yakho ihluleka, zama esilula njengokuthi: "Yini eyindilinga ephonswayo noma ekhahlelwayo?"Impendulo: "Ibhola" ⚽

SourceText: Your child can also try making riddles! 💡
text: Ingane yakho nayo ingazama ukuphicaphica! 💡

SourceText: You can have fun with riddles anywhere at any time - like traveling on a bus, walking to school or in a car 🚗
text: Ningazijabulisa ngeziphicaphicano noma inini nanoma ikuphi - njengokuhamba ngebhasi, ukuhamba ngezinyawo ukuya esikoleni noma phakathi kwemoto 🚗

SourceText: *Make up a Story*
text: *Yakha Indaba*

SourceText: Creating stories together is a great way to have fun with imagination - and to build your child’s creativity! 📖
text: Ukwakha izindaba ndawonye indlela enhle yokuzijabulisa ngomcabango - nokwakha ubuhlakani enganeni yakho! 📖

SourceText: 5️⃣ With your child, come up with 5 words to use. They can be any words you want! For example: banana, spaceship, fish, water, painting, cooking, wedding. If you need to remember them, write them clearly on a paper with your child.
text: 5️⃣ Ungaqhamuka namagama awu 5 ozowasebenzisa nengane yakho. Kungaba inoba imaphi amagama owafunayo wena! Isibonelo: ubhanana, umkhumbi, ufishi, isithombe esidwetshiwe sapendwa, ukupheka, umshado. Uma ufuna ukuwakhumbula wabhale ngokucacile ephepheni nengane yakho.

SourceText: 🎂 Start your story with, “Once upon a time, there was a…” and use one of the words from the list in the first part. For example, “Once upon a time, there was a family who worked on a *banana* farm.”
text: 🎂 Qala indaba yakho ngokuthi, "Kwasukasukela, kwakukhona i..." bese uqinisekakisa ukuthi usebenzisa elilodwa igama kuhlu lwakho. Isibonelo, "Kwasukasukela, kwakukhona umndeni owawusebenza efamu *labhanana*."

SourceText: 📝 Let your child make up the next part using another word from the list.
text: 📝 Dedela ingane yakho icabange umusho ngokusebenzisa elinye igama kuloluhlu.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns until you have used all the words and created a story.
text: 🔄 Shintshisanani nize nisebenzise wonke amagama futhi seniyakhile indaba.

SourceText: 🔔 Be creative and do not tell your child what to say. It does not need to be a real story to be fun!
text: 🔔 Yiba nobuhlakani futhi ungayitsheli ingane yakho ukuthi ithini. Akudingeki ukuthi kube indaba yangempela ukuze ijabulise!

SourceText: 🎁 Ask your child what their favourite part of the story was, and tell them yours!
text: 🎁 Buza ingane yakho ukuthi iyiphi ingxenye eyithandile kulendaba, nawe uyitshele eyakho!

SourceText: *Playing with Clothes*
text: *Ukudlala Ngezimpahla*

SourceText: 💡 Clothes can be the perfect ‘toys’ to help your child build fine motor skills, recognise colours, and think! Here are 3 ideas you can try:
text: 💡 Izingubo zokugqoka zingakulungela ukuba amathoyizi ukulekelela ukwakha amakhono okuphila, ukuqaphela imibala nokucabanga: Nansi imibono ewu 3 ongayizama:

SourceText: 👋 Practice
text: 👋Phrakhthiza

SourceText: Help your child exercise their fingers by showing them how buttons and zips work on clothes, and letting them practise using them!
text: Siza ingane yakho ukuvocavoca iminwe ngokuyikhombisa ukuthi izinkinobho noziphu zisebenza kanjani ezimpahleni, bese uyayidedela iphrakthize ukuzisebenzisa!

SourceText: 🔵 Colours
text: 🔵 Imibala

SourceText: Talk about the colours of clothes! Ask your child to name the colours of their clothes and talk about all the things that are that colour: “What are all the things we can think of that are blue?”
text: Khulumani ngemibala yezimpahla! Buza ingane yakho ngemibala yezimpahla niphinde nikhulume nangezinye izinto ezinaloyo mbala: "Yiziphi ezinye izinto esingazicabanga eziwumbala oluhlaza njengesibhakabhaka?"

SourceText: 🔶 Sorting
text: 🔶 Ukuhlunga

SourceText: When you have done laundry, ask your child to help you sort clothes into piles for each family member.
text: Uma usuqedile ukuwasha, cela ingane yakho ikusize ukuhlukanisa izimpahla zibe yiqoqo lelunga ngalinye lomndeni.

SourceText: *Playing with Vegetables*
text: *Ukudlala Ngemimfino*

SourceText: 🌱 Help your child learn by thinking and talking about vegetables! Here are 3 ideas for you:
text: 🌱 Siza ingane yakho ukufunda ngokucabanga nokukhuluma ngemimfino! Nansi imibono yakho ewu 3:

SourceText: 🍅 Sorting vegetablesMix together 2-3 different ingredients of your choice (like onions, tomatoes and corn example). Say: “Help me sort these vegetables into piles?” Try sorting them by size.
text: 🍅 Ukuhlukanisa imimfinoUyihlanganise ndawonye izithako eziwu 2-3 ozithandayo (njengo anyanisi, tamatisi nombila isibonelo) Ithi "Ngisize ukuhlukanisa lemimfino ibe ngamaqoqo?" Zama ukukuhlukanisa ngosayizi.

SourceText: 😃 Remind me!
text: 😃 Ngikhumbuze!

SourceText: Talk about your child’s experiences. Ask questions and wait for answers. Follow your child’s interests.
text: Khuluma ngezinto ingane yakho ezibonile. Buza imibuzo futhi ulinde izimpendulo. Landela izinto ingane yakho ezithokozelayo.

SourceText: “Can you help me remember what is at the market?” “Do they sell carrots at the market?” “Do they sell anything yellow at the market?” “What else do they sell?”
text: "Ungangisiza ukukhumbula ukuthi yini esemakethe?" "Ingabe bayawudayisa ukherothi emakethe?" "Ingabe ikhona into ephuzi edayiswayo emakethe?" Yini enye abayidayisayo?"

SourceText: 💡 Something similar
text: 💡 Okuthile okufanayo

SourceText: Say: We are going to think of some things that are similar or different from what I tell you. So listen carefully!”
text: Ithi: "Sizocabanga izinto ezifanayo noma ezehlukile kunalokho engizokusho kuwena. Lalelisisa"

SourceText: Here is a tomato. Can you think of something else that is red like a tomato? 🍅
text: Nawu utamatisi. Ungacabanga enye into ebomvu njengotamatisi? 🍅

SourceText: Can you think of something else that is round like a tomato? ⚽
text: Ungacabanga enye into eyindingiliza njengotamatisi? ⚽

SourceText: These fun food games build memory, observation, and language - helping your child compare, recall, and explore the world through everyday things 🏆
text: Lemidlalo ejabulisayo yokudla yakha inkumbulo, ukubona nolimi - ukusiza ingane yakho ukuqhathanisa, ukukhumbula nokuhlola umhlaba ngzinto zansuku zonke 🏆

SourceText: *Animals*
text: *Izilwane*

SourceText: Here are 3 fun animal-related games you can play!
text: Nayi imidlalo ewu 3 engezilwane ejabulisayo ongayidlala!

SourceText: 🧸 Active animals Take turns with @fields.child_nickname doing animal actions: Hop like a frog, stretch like a cat, run like a dog, slither like a snake, flap like a bird.
text: 🧸 Izilwane ezikhutheleShintshanani no@fields.child_nickname ngokulingisa izilwane: Gxuma njengeselesele, nwebeka njengekati, gijima njengenja, shibilika njengenyoka, shaya amaphiko njengenyoni.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🧸 Active animals Take turns with your child doing animal actions: Hop like a frog, stretch like a cat, run like a dog, slither like a snake, flap like a bird.
text: 🧸 Izilwane ezikhutheleShintshanani nengane yakho ukulingisa izilwane: Gxuma njengeselesele, nwebeka njengekati, shibilika njengenyoka, shaya amaphiko njengenyoni.

SourceText: 💡 Groups of animals
text: 💡 Amaqembu ezilwane

SourceText: What are all the animals we can think of that have feathers?
text: Iziphi izilwane esingazicabanga ezinamaphiko?

SourceText: What are all the animals we can think of that eat plants? 🌱
text: Iziphi izilwane esingazicabanga ezidla izitshalo? 🌱

SourceText: What are all the animals we can think of that lay eggs?
text: Iziphi  izilwane esingazicabanga ezizalela amaqanda?

SourceText: 😃 Counting rabbits
text: 😃 Ukubala onogwaja

SourceText: 🔟 Find 10 rocks and tell your child that they are rabbits!
text: 🔟 Thola amatshe awu 10 bese utshela ingane ukuthi onogwaja!

SourceText: Put them in a line and ask them to count the rabbits.
text: Wabeke abe ulayini ucele ingane ibale onogwaja.

SourceText: Ask your child to give you 3 rabbits. Say “If you give me 3, how many rabbits do you have?”
text: Cela ingane yakho ikunike onogwaja abawu 3. Uthi"Uma unginika abawu 3, usala nonogwaja abangakhi?"

SourceText: These playful animal games build movement, counting, and thinking skills - while sparking your child’s curiosity about the natural world 🌈
text: Lemidlalo yezilwane yakha umnyakazo, ukubala namakhono okucabanga - ngenkathi ikhanyisa ilukuluku kwingane yakho ngokwendalo yomhlaba 🌈

SourceText: *Active Counting*
text: *Ukubala Ngokwenza*

SourceText: Here are 2 fun games that help your child learn how to count, listen, and remember!
text: Nayi imidlalo ewu- 2 ejabulisayo futhi esiza ingane yakho indlela yokufunda ukubala, ukulalela nokukhumbula!

SourceText: 👋 Clap, hop, jump:
text: 👋 Shaya izandla, gxuma-gxuma, gxuma:

SourceText: Play the following game with @fields.child_nickname. Make it active!
text: Dlala lomdlalo olandelayo no-@fields.child_nickname. Kwenze kube nomdladla!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 1️⃣ Clap hands 1 time. 2️⃣ Clap hands 2 times.
text: 1️⃣ Shaya izandla kanye. 2️⃣ Shaya izandla kabili.

SourceText: 1️⃣ Jump 1 time. 2️⃣ Jump 2 times.
text: 1️⃣ Gxuma kanye. 2️⃣ Gxuma kabili.

SourceText: 1️⃣ Hop 1 time. 3️⃣ Hop 3 times.
text: 1️⃣ Gxuma kanye. 3️⃣ Gxuma-gxuma kathathu.

SourceText: 💡 Can you hop, then jump, then clap?
text: 💡 Ungagxuma-gxuma, bese uyagxuma, bese ushaya izandla?

SourceText: 🏆 Can you clap twice, jump once, and hop three times?
text: 🏆 Ungashaya izandla kabili, ugxume kanye, bese ugxuma-gxuma kancane kathathu?

SourceText: Play the following game with your child. Make it active!
text: Dlala lomdlalo olandelayo nengane yakho. Yenza kube nomdlandla!

SourceText: 💡 Remembering Instructions
text: 💡 Ukukhumbula Imiyalelo

SourceText: Take turns to give 2-3 instructions that the other person has to follow. Make sure physical movement is included!
text: Shintshanani ngokunikana imiyalelo ewu 2-3 omunye umuntu kumele ayilandele. Qinisekakisa ukuthi umnyakazo womzimba uyingxenye yalokhu!

SourceText: For example:
text: Isibonelo:

SourceText: - Hop twice, then turn around.
text: - Gxuma-gxuma kancane kabili, phenduka.

SourceText: - Jump to the kitchen, pick up a spoon, then run back. ✅
text: - Gxumela ekhishini, cosha isipuni, bese ugijima ubuyele emuva. ✅

SourceText: These active games builds memory, coordination, and listening skills - helping your child follow instructions while moving their body 👋
text: Lemidlalo enomdlandla yakha inkumbulo, ukuxhumanisa namakhono okulalela - okusiza ingane yakho ikwazi ukulandela imiyalelo ngesikhathi inyakazisa umzimba wakhe 👋

SourceText: *Thinking Games*
text: *Imidlalo Yokucabanga*

SourceText: Let’s play some games to help your child think and follow instructions!
text: Masidlale imidlalo ukusiza ingane yakho ukucabanga nokulandela imiyalelo!

SourceText: ❗ Mama/Daddy says!
text: ❗ Mama/Baba uthi!

SourceText: Give your child brief instructions to follow, by saying: “Mama/daddy says… touch your head”.
text: Nika ingane yakho imiyalelo emifishane ukuze iyilandele, njengokuthi "Umama/baba uthi..... thinta ikhanda lakho".

SourceText: “Mama/daddy says… jump twice”.
text: "Umama/ubaba uthi... gxuma kabili"

SourceText: Once your child understands the game well, you can make it more complicated!
text: Uma ingane yakho isiwuqonda kahle umdlalo, ungawenza ube nzinyana!

SourceText: “Mama/daddy says… jump, then clap and sit”.
text: "Umama/ubaba uthi... gxuma, bese ushaya izandla futhi uhlala phansi".

SourceText: 🔵 🔴 Blue-Red
text: 🔵 🔴 Luhlaza okwesibhakabhaka - Bomvu

SourceText: Say a colour, and your child needs to quickly find and touch something of that colour.
text: Isho umbala, bese ingane yakho kumele isheshe iyothinta into onaloyo mbala.

SourceText: To make the game harder, you can choose two colours and tell your child they should touch the opposite colour!
text: Ukwenza umdlalo ubenzinyana, ungakhetha imibala emibili bese utshela ingane yakho ukuthi ithinte umbala ophambene nalona owushilo!

SourceText: “If I say blue, you should touch something red. If I say red, you need to touch something blue.”
text: "Uma ngithi oluhlaza njengesibhakabhaka wena uthinta into ebomvu. Uma ngithi bomvu, kumele uthinte into eluhlaza njengesibhakabhaka".

SourceText: Try these games to help your child build listening skills, follow instructions, and have fun - all at the same time!
text: Zama lemidlalo khona kuzosiza ingane yakho ukwakha amakhono okulalela, ukulandela imiyalelo, nokujabula - konke ngesikhathi esisodwa!

SourceText: 👂 Go and stop
text: 👂 Hamba futhi ume

SourceText: Say: When I say “stop”, we freeze. When I say “go”, we can walk again.
text: Ithi: Uma ngithi "ima", asinyakazi. Uma ngithi "hamba", singahamba futhi.

SourceText: Once @fields.child_nickname is familiar with the game, @fields.child_nickname will lead.
text: Uma u@fields.child_nickname esewujwayele lo mdlalo, u@fields.child_nickname uzohola.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Once your child is familiar with the game, your child will lead.
text: Uma ingane yakho esiwujwayele lo mdlalo, ingane yakho uzohola.

SourceText: *Games with Pictures!*
text: *Imidlalo Enezithombe!*

SourceText: Any picture or image can turn into a game:
text: Noma isiphi isithombe singaphenduka umdlalo:

SourceText: 👂 Making up a story
text: 👂 Ukuqamba indaba

SourceText: Find a picture with people or animals in an old newspaper, book, or magazine, or on packaging.
text: Thola isithombe esinabantu noma izilwane kwiphephandaba elidala, incwadi, noma imagazini, noma ephaketheni.

SourceText: Say: “Let’s make up a story about this picture. I can start. This little girl is feeling very excited today. Why do you think she is feeling excited?”
text: Ngokwesibonelo, ithi: Sizokwakha indaba mayelana nalesi sithombe. Ngingaqala. Le ntombazane encane izizwa ijabule kakhulu namhlanje. Ucabanga ukuthi kungani izizwa ijabulile?

SourceText: 😃 “She is holding her bag and has a big smile. Where do you think she is going?”
text: 😃 “Uphethe isikhwama sakhe futhi umamatheka kakhulu. Ucabanga ukuthi uyaphi?”

SourceText: 👀 Can you guess it?
text: 👀 Ungaqagela?

SourceText: Say: “I am going to describe something on the page and you need to guess what it is and point to it”. For example, “I see something that is green and moves slowly.
text: Uthi: "Ngizochaza okuthile kulelipheji kumele uqagele ukuthi yini futhi uyikhombe". Isibonelo "Ngibona into eluhlaza enyakaza kancane."

SourceText: Can you guess what it is?” 💚
text: Ungaqagela ukuthi yini?" 💚

SourceText: These playful games build imagination, language, and thinking skills - while helping your child listen and express their own ideas in a fun way 💡
text: Lemidlalo isiza ekwakheni imifanekiso-ngqondweni, ulimi namakhono okucabanga - ngesikhathi isiza ingane yakho ukulalela futhi nokukhuluma ngemibono yayo ngendlela ejabulisayo 💡

SourceText: *Tell Me a Story!*
text: *Ngitshele indaba!*

SourceText: 👂 Sit together in a cosy spot and begin a story the traditional way in your home language, like “Once upon a time...”
text: 👂 Hlalani ndawonye endaweni ethokomele bese uqala indaba ngendlela yakudala ngolimi lwasekhaya. kanje "Kwasuka Sukela..."

SourceText: ✨ Use your voice, hands, and expressions to bring the story to life. It could be about animals, a clever child, or a talking tree! Let your child add sounds or repeat words. You can even ask them what happens next!
text: ✨ Sebenzisa iphimbo lakho, izandla nokusebenzisa umzimba ukwenza indaba ikholakale. Ingaba ngezilwane, ingane ehlakaniphile noma isihlahla esikhulumayo! Vumela ingane yakho ingeze imsindo noma iphinde amagama. Ungayibuza ukuthi kwenzekani ngokulandelayo!

SourceText: 💡 Traditional storytelling builds language, imagination, and cultural identity - and creates beautiful quiet time together.
text: 💡 Ukuxoxa indaba ngendlela yakudala kwakha ulimi, ukuba nomfanekiso-ngqondweni nokwazi ngamasiko - futhi kwakha isikhathi esihle esinokuthula ndawonye.

SourceText: *Proverb Play*
text: *Umdlalo Wezaga*

SourceText: Let’s bring wisdom to life through play! ✨
text: Masilethe ubuhlakani ngokudlala! ✨

SourceText: 🌱 Think of a traditional proverb and act it out together. Pretend to be the animal or act out the scenario of the proverb - use movement, voices, and imagination!
text: 🌱 Cabanga ngesaga sakudala nilingise ndawonye. Yenza sengathi uyisilwane noma ulingise isiqephu sesaga - sebenzisa umnyakazo, iphimbo nomcabango!

SourceText: 📖 Here are some ideas to get you started:
text: 📖 Nansi eminye imibino ukukulekelela ukuqala:

SourceText: - “Even an ant can hurt an elephant” - Pretend to be a big stomping elephant, then tiny ants that tickle its feet!
text: - "Noma ngabe intuthwane ilimaza indlovu" - Yenza sengathi uyindlovu enkulu egxobayo, bese izintuthwane ezinyane zikitaza unyawo lwayo!

SourceText: - “The lion doesn’t turn around when a small dog barks” - Be the calm, wise lion ignoring a noisy pup.
text: - "Ibhubesi alijiki uma likhonkothwa inja encane" - Iba ibhubesi elizothile, elihlakaniphile eliziba umsindo womdlwane.

SourceText: - “Wisdom is like a baobab tree - no one can embrace it alone” - Stand in a circle and stretch your arms to build a tree together.
text: - "Ubuhlakani bunjenge sihlahla sebaobab - akekho ongasamukela eyedwa" - Yimani nenze isikokela nilule izingalo ukwakha isihlahla ndawonye.

SourceText: - “A single bracelet does not jingle” - Clap or tap together and see how much louder it is with more hands!
text: - "Ibhengela uma lilodwa alikhali" - Shayani izandla noma uthinte nibone ungakanani umsindo uma izandla ziningi!

SourceText: 👀Ask your child what they think the proverb means.
text: 👀 Buza ingane yakho ukuthi icabanga ukuthi isaga sichaza ukuthini.

SourceText: This playful activity helps children explore big ideas like courage, kindness, and teamwork - through their bodies and imagination 💡
text: Lomsebenzi onomdlalo usiza ingane ukuthi ihlole imibono emikhulu njenge sibindi, umusa nokusebenzisana - ngokwemizimba nemifanekiso-ngqondweni 💡

SourceText: *I'm a Writer!*
text: *Ngingumbhali!*

SourceText: 📝 Have fun being creative with writing!
text: 📝 Zijabulise ngokusungula ukubhala!

SourceText: You and @fields.child_nickname can have fun writing with a pencil and paper, or with a stick and the sand!
text: Wena no@fields.child_nickname ningazijabulisa ngokubhala ngempensela nephepha, noma ngothi nesimhlabathi!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: If your child doesn’t know how to write letters, encourage them to draw shapes, and try to copy the shapes of letters. 🔵▶️
text: Uma ingane yakho ingakwazi ukubhala ama-alfabhethi, yikhuthaze idwebe amasheyiphu, futhi izame ukukopisha amasheyiphu ama-alfabethi. 🔵▶️

SourceText: When they are more confident, encourage them to write letters and even words. 😃
text: Uma inokuzethemba kakhulu, yikhuthaze ukuthi ibhale ama- alfabhethi namagama 😃

SourceText: Start showing them how to write their name and other important words for them, like mom, ball or milk.
text: Qala ngoyikhombisa ukuthi libhalwa kanjani igama layo namanye amagama abululekile, njengo mama, ibhola noma ubisi.

SourceText: Show them the simple things that you write - like shopping lists! Show them the words and each of the letters. Let them try to copy the words! 📖
text: Yitshengise izinto ezilula ozibhalayo - njengohlu lokuthenga! Yitshengise amagama nama-alfabethi akhona. Yidedele izame ukukopisha amagama! 📖

SourceText: You and your child can have fun writing with a pencil and paper, or with a stick and the sand!
text: Wena nengane yakho ningazijabulisa ngokubhala ngempensela nephepha, noma ngothi nesihlabathi!

SourceText: 🎉This playful writing time builds confidence, creativity, and early literacy - helping your child see that writing is useful and fun.
text: 🎉 Lesikhathi somdlalo wokubhala sakha ukuzithemba, ubuhlakani nokufunda ngokushesha - ukusiza ingane yakho ibone ukuthi ukubhala kubalulekile futhi kuyajabulisa.

SourceText: *A Friendly Chat*
text: *Inkulumo Yobungani*

SourceText: Talk to your child about something that they are interested in! 😃
text: Khuluma nengane yakho ngokuthile enentshisekelo kukho! 😃
