SourceText: 💚 Spending quality time with your child and talking to them every day is a good way to develop a strong relationship.
text: 💚 Ukuchitha isikhathi esikhethekile nengane yakho nokukhuluma nayo nsuku zonke indlela enhle yokwakha ubudlelwane obuqinile.

SourceText: ⚽ An easy way to start talking to your child is to ask them about something they are interested in, for example you could talk about topics such as: sports, books, movies, friends, music, celebrities, or school.
text: ⚽ Indlela elula yokuqala ukukhuluma nengane yakho ukubuza ngento enentshisekelo yayo, isibonelo ungakhuluma ngezihloko ezifana nezemidlalo, izincwadi, amafilimu, abangani, umculo, usaziwayo noma isikole.

SourceText: 👂 You may not find everything your child shares to be interesting, but it’s important to show enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn.
text: 👂 Ungase ungatholi yonke into ingane yakho eyabelana ngayo ithandeka, kodwa kubalulekile ukukhombisa umdlandla kanye nokulangazelela ukufunda.

SourceText: Talking about their interests builds trust, confidence, and communication skills - and shows your child that what they care about matters to you 💛
text: Ukukhuluma ngezinto anentshisekelo ngazo kwakha ukuthembana, ukuzigqaja, namakhono okuxoxisana - futhi kukhombisa ingane yakho ukuthi lokhu akukhathalele unendaba nako 💛

SourceText: *Get Active*
text: *Yiba matasa*

SourceText: Exercise is a great way to spend time together and it is so good for your health.
text: Ukuzivocavoca indlela enhle yokuchitha isikhathi ndawonye futhi kuyilungele impilo yakho.

SourceText: 🌱 Find a sport or exercise that both you and your child want to do and try it out together!
text: 🌱 Thola umdlalo noma nizivocavoce wena nengane yakho futhi nizame ukukwenza lokhu ndawonye!

SourceText: ⏰ Even walking for 10 minutes a day is good for you.
text: ⏰ Ukuhamba noma imizuzu ewu- 10 ngosuku kukulungele.

SourceText: ⚽ Together you can walk, run, play soccer, swim, dance, or do any other sport.
text: ⚽ Ningahamba, nigijime, nidlale ibhola, nibhukude, nidanse, noma nenze omunye umdlalo ndawonye.

SourceText: 🏆 Together, think of ways to make it even more fun. Can you jog to a certain point? Take turns being the coach? Can there be a small, free reward, like getting to decide the next activity?
text: 🏆 Ndawonye, cabangani izindlela zokwenza kubemnandi kakhulu. Ningagigjima kancane nize nifike endaweni ethize? Nishintshisane ngokuba ngumqeqeshi? Kungaba nomklomelo omncane, omahhala njengokukhetha into eningayenza elandelayo?

SourceText: 🌈 Exercise becomes easier and more enjoyable the more you do it.
text: 🌈 Ukuzivocavoca kubalula futhi kuba mnandi mawuqhubeka ukwenza.

SourceText: 🔄 If you or your child do not like the first exercise you pick, try a new exercise.
text: 🔄 Uma wena nengane yakho ningawuthandi umsebenzi wokuqala eniwukhethile, zamani umsebenzi omusha.

SourceText: *Pass the Ball*
text: *Dlulisa Ibhola*

SourceText: Games are a great, fun way to spend time with your family!
text: Imidlalo ayindlela enhle, ejabulisanayo ukuchitha isikhathi nomndeni wakho!

SourceText: 3️⃣ This game is best with at least 3 people.
text: 3️⃣ Lo mdlalo ulungele abantu abawu- 3 kuyela phezulu.

SourceText: ⚽ Find a ball to play. If you cannot find a ball, choose an item you can safely throw around. For example, a bottle cap or a plastic cup.
text: ⚽ Thola ibhola lokudlala. Uma ungalitholi ibhola, khetha into ephephile ongakwazi ukuyiphonsa. Isibonelo, isivalo sebhodlela noma inkomishi yeplastiki.

SourceText: ➡️ Start in a circle and pass the ball around.
text: ➡️ Qalani endingilizini bese nidluliselana ibhola.

SourceText: 👋 Start throwing the ball in new directions (up, down, straight, curved, rolling on the ground) and with different forces (hard, soft, medium). You can bounce the ball, throw it in the air, and catch it a few times before passing it.
text: 👋 Qala uphonse ibhola ngezindlela ezihlukile (phezulu, phansi, phambili, indlela egobile, ulirole phansi) futhi ngamandla ahlukile (ngokuqina, ngokuthamba, ngendlela ephakathi). Ungagxumimisa ibhola, uliphonse emoyeni, bese ulibamba kaningi ngaphambi kokulidlulisa.

SourceText: ✨ When everyone gets good at catching the ball, you can start moving around the room, still passing the ball.
text: ✨ Uma bonke abantu sebelibamba kahle ibhola, ungaqala ukuhamba-hamba egumbini, usaqhubeka udlulisa ngokuphonsa ibhola.

SourceText: ⭐ Can you throw the ball under the leg? Behind the back? Over your head? Block a pass? Have fun with it!
text: ⭐ Ungakwazi ukuphonsa ibhola ngaphansi komlenze? Ngemuva? Phezu kwekhanda lakho? Vimba iphasi? Zithokozise ngayo!

SourceText: This lively game helps you connect to your child in a fun way - while building their coordination, teamwork, and focus 🚩
text: Lomdlalo ophilayo ukusiza ukuxhumana nengane yakho ngendlela ejabulisayo - ngesikhathi nakha ukuxhumana, ukusebenzisana nokugxila 🚩

SourceText: *Follow the Leader!*
text: *Landela Umholi!*

SourceText: ⭐ Choose someone to be the leader (tip: start with an adult like yourself).
text: ⭐ Khetha omunye umuntu abe ngumholi( ithiphu: qala ngomuntu omdala njengawe).

SourceText: 😃 Other players line up behind the leader. The leader moves around in any way they like!
text: 😃 Abanye abadlali bama emuva komholi. Umholi uyanyakaza nganoma iyiphi indlela ayithandayo!

SourceText: 🏁 They can run, jump, crawl, walk on tiptoe, and any other way they want!
text: 🏁 Bangagijima, bagxume, bakhase, banyonyobe, noma iyiphi enye indlela ayifunayo!

SourceText: 👀 The other players must copy what the leader does, and the leader can change movements at any time.
text: 👀 Abanye abadlali kufanele balingise izenzo zomholi, futhi umholi angashintsha umnyakazo noma inini.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns being the leader, and remember, you can play with just two people or as many as you want!
text: 🔄 Shintshanani ngokuba umholi, futhi ukhumbule, ungadlala nabantu ababili noma abaningi ofisa ngayo!

SourceText: This game builds movement skills, attention and listening, and self-control, while having fun together! 👂
text: Lomdlalo wakha amakhono okunyakaza, ukuqaphela nokulalela, nokuzithiba, ngenkathi nijabule ndawonye! 👂

SourceText: *Emotion Cards*
text: *Amakhadi Emizwa*

SourceText: Create cards of the main six emotions with @fields.child_nickname: happy, sad, angry, disgusted, surprised, afraid 😃😔😣
text: Yakha amakhadi emizwa emikhulu eyisithupha no@fields.child_nickname: injabulo, ukudumela, ukuthukuthela, ukunyanya, ukumangela, ukwesaba 😃😔😣
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🔶 Draw, cut-out pictures from magazines, or take photos of family members showing different emotions.
text: 🔶 Dweba, sika izithombe kumagazini, noma uthathe izithombe zamalunga omndeni bekhombisa imizwa ehlukene.

SourceText: 📝 Label each emotion and describe how each family member feels those emotions.
text: 📝 Bhala umuzwa ngamunye bese uchaza ukuthi ilunga ngalinye lomndeni lizizwa kanjani.

SourceText: Create cards of the main six emotions with your child: happy, sad, angry, disgusted, surprised, afraid 😃😔😣
text: Yakha amakhadi emizwa emikhulu eyisithupha nengane yakho: jabulile, dumele, thukuthele, dumazeka, mangele, kwesaba 😃😔😣

SourceText: 🚩 Put the cards in a spot everyone agrees on, and use it throughout the day to name how everyone is feeling. For example, after school, everyone can point out the emotion they are experiencing.
text: 🚩 Beka amakhadi endaweni lapho wonke umuntu evuma ukuthi abekwe khona, bese uwasebenzisa usuku lonke ukusho ukuthi umuntu ngamunye uzizwa kanjani. Isibonelo, emuva kokuphuma kwesikole wonke umuntu angakhomba umuzwa awuzwayo.

SourceText: 💡 Feel free to add new feelings as they come up. If someone doesn’t know what they are feeling, help them identify it by exploring how it feels in their body. Try together to find a new word for that emotion.
text: 💡 Khululeka ungangeza imizwa emisha uma isaqhamuka. Uma kukhona ongazazi ukuthi uzizwa kanjani, msize ukuthola ngokuhlola ukuthi uzizwa kanjani emzimbeni wakhe. Zamani ukuthola igama elisha laloyo muzwa.

SourceText: This can help everyone in the family become experts in understanding themselves and be aware of what their bodies need! 💛
text: Lokhu kungasiza wonke umuntu emndenini abe nguchwepheshe ngokuzazi nokuqonda ukuthi imizimba yabo idingani! 💛

SourceText: *What's New?*
text: *Yini Entsha?*

SourceText: Learning together is fun! 🎓
text: Ukufunda ndawonye kuyajabulisa! 🎓

SourceText: ❓ Ask your child to think of a new, fun skill you could learn together.
text: ❓ Cela ingane yakho ukuthi icabange ikhono elisha, elimnandi eningalifunda ndawonye.

SourceText: For example: keeping a ball in the air with your foot, juggling, making soup, moonwalking, whistling, saying the alphabet backwards, learning all the countries in Africa.
text: Isibonelo: ukugcina ibhola emoyeni ngonyawo lwakho, ukuphonsa amabhola emoyeni uwabambe, ukwenza isobo, ukudansa, ukushaya ikhwela, ukusho i-alfabethi uqala ekugcineni, ukufunda wonke amazwe e-Afrika.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns trying out the new skill. Make sure to praise each other and learn and play together!
text: 🔄 Shintshisanani ngokunizama ikhono elisha. Qinisekisa ukuthi niyancomana futhi nifunde futhi nidlale ndwawonye!

SourceText: 💛 Approach learning the skill in a kind and fun way, and do not judge your child or yourself for your ability in the skill.
text: 💛 Ukufunda ikhono kuqhamukele ngendlela enomusa nejabulisayo, futhi ungayehluleli ingane yakho noma wena ngokwakho ngekhono lakho kulelikhono lokufunda.

SourceText: 😃 Once you have mastered the skill, choose another skill to learn together.
text: 😃 Uma seniphumelele kulelo khono, khethani elinye ikhono eningalifunda ndawonye.

SourceText: *Five Stones*
text: *Amatshe Amahlanu*

SourceText: Let’s test your speed and skill with this classic hand game played across South Africa! ⭐
text: Make sihlole ukushesha nekhono lakho ngomdlalo wesandla wakudala odlalwa eNingizimu Africa yonke ⭐

SourceText: 5️⃣ You’ll need five small stones (or any small objects you have around).
text: 5️⃣ Uzodinga amatshe amancane amahlanu (noma izinto ezincane onazo eduze kwakho).

SourceText: ▶️ Start by placing all five on the ground. Pick up one and throw it gently into the air. While it’s in the air, quickly grab one stone from the ground and catch the first stone before it lands.
text: ▶️ Qala ngokuwabeka womahlanu phansi. Cosha elilodwa uliphonse phezulu ngokumnene. Uma lisasephezulu emoyeni, bamba itshe elilodwa kulawa owabeke phansi bese ushesha unqaka leli lokuqala ngaphambi kokuthi lifike phansi.

SourceText: 🔄 Repeat this, picking up one stone at a time. Then try two at once, then three... all the way to four!
text: 🔄 Phinda lokhu, cosha itshe elilodwa ngesikhathi. Bese uzama amabili ngesikhathi esisodwa, bese kuba amathathu... njalo ukhuphukela kwamane!

SourceText: 🚩 Play alone or with friends, and see who can complete the challenge without dropping a stone!
text: 🚩 Dlala wedwa noma nabangani, nibone ukuthi ngubani uzoqeda inselelo engaliwisanga itshe!

SourceText: This traditional game builds hand-eye coordination, focus, and timing - and it’s lots of fun to master ✅
text: Lomdlalo wakudala wakha ukuhsebensizana kwamehlo nesandla, ukugxila nokukala isikhathi - kuyintokozo enkulu ukunqoba ✅

SourceText: *Clap & Sing Game*
text: *Umdlalo wokucula nokushaya izandla*

SourceText: 🎵 Sit face-to-face with your child and try a fun clapping rhyme together.
text: 🎵 Hlalani nibhekane nengane yakho nizame umlolozelo ojabulisayo wokushaya izandla, ndawonye.

SourceText: 👋 Clap your hands, then each other’s, and repeat with a rhythm and song from your childhood – or make up a new one.
text: 👋 Shaya izandla zakho, bese ushaya ezomunye uphinde isigqi nengoma yangezikhathi zobungane bakho - noma uziqambele entsha.

SourceText: 💚 Follow the words with a simple clapping pattern. You can swap in your own words or names to make it even more fun!
text: 💚 Landela amagama ngendlela elula yokushaya izandla ngendlela efanayo. Ungashintshanisa ngamagama akho ukuyenza ijabulise kakhulu!

SourceText: These clapping games have been popular among children from generation to generation, and help build rhythm, timing, memory, and laughter ✨
text: Lemidlalo yokushaya izandla idume kakhulu ezinganeni ukusukela esizukulwaneni ukuya esizukulwaneni, isiza ukwakha isigqi, ukukala isikhathi, inkumbulo nokuhleka ✨

SourceText: *Skipping Rope Song*
text: *Izingoma zokudlala ingqathu*

SourceText: 🎈 Find a long rope or make one from tied-up tights or string.
text: 🎈 Thola intambo ende noma uzenzele ngentambo eboshiwe ngama-thayithi noma ngezinqamu sezintambo.

SourceText: 2️⃣ Two people turn the rope while one jumps in the middle.
text: 2️⃣ Abantu ababili baphendula intambo ngenkathi oyedwa egxuma esiphakathini.

SourceText: 🎵 Sing a song together as they jump – do you remember one from your childhood or can you use a different song you all know?
text: 🎵 Culani ingoma nonke nkathi esagxuma - uyayikhumbula eyodwa enaniyicula niseyizingane noma ningasebenzisa elinye iculo enilaziyo nonke?

SourceText: 🏆 You can add fun moves like hopping, clapping, or even dancing while skipping.
text: 🏆 Ningangeza eminye iminyakazo ejabulisayo, njengokugxuma ngomlenze owodwa, ukushaya izandla, nokudansa ngesikhathi ugxuma.

SourceText: 💛 Then switch places so everyone gets a turn.
text: 💛 Bese niyashintshana ngezindawo wonke umuntu athole ithuba.

SourceText: This energetic game builds coordination, confidence, and teamwork - and brings a joyful beat to any outdoor play session 🌈
text: Lomdlalo onomdlandla wakha ukusebenzisana kwamalunga omzimba ahlukene ngesikhathi esisidwa, ukuzethemba kanye nokusebenzisana niyiqembu - futhi kuletha isigqi esimnandi ngesikhathi sokudlala ngaphandle 🌈

SourceText: *Three Tin Tower*
text: *Umbhoshongo Wamathini Amamthathu*

SourceText: 🔶 Stack three empty tins into a tower.
text: 🔶 Yenza isitaki ngamathini amathathu angenalutho wenze umbhoshongo.

SourceText: 🔵 One player throws a soft ball to knock them down while others run away.
text: 🔵 Umdlali oyedwa uphonsa ibhola elithambile awabhidlize ngenkathi abanye bebaleka.

SourceText: ⏰ The “tin guard” collects and rebuilds the tower as quickly as possible while trying to tag the runners.
text: ⏰ Umqaphi wamathini uyawaqoqa aphinde akhe umbhoshongo ngokushesha ngenkathi ezama ukuthega abagijimayo.

SourceText: 🔄 If you get tagged, you switch roles!
text: 🔄 Makwenzeka uthegwa, niyashintshana ngendima!

SourceText: This game is lots of fun and builds teamwork, movement skills, and fast thinking 🎉
text: Lomdlalo uyajabulisa kakhulu futhi wakha ukusebenzisana, amakhono okunyakaza nokucabanga ngokushesha 🎉

SourceText: *Story Stones*
text: *Indaba Yamatshe*

SourceText: 🔴 Sit quietly with a handful of small stones.
text: 🔴 Hlala ngokuthula uphathe amatshe amancane agcwale isandla.

SourceText: 📖 Let your child imagine what the stones are, move them around and tell a story in their own words. It might be about animals, people, dreams, or anything they imagine.
text: 📖 Dedela ingane yakho icabange ukuthi awani lamatshe, wanyakazise bese uxoxa indaba ngamagama abo. Kungaba ngezilwane, abantu, amaphupho noma ngani abangayicabanga.

SourceText: 👂You can listen quietly or help shape the story together.
text: 👂 Ungalalela ngokuthula noma usize ukubumba lendaba ndawonye.

SourceText: This solo storytelling tradition helps children express feelings, practise language, and explore imagination - all through play and pretend 💛
text: Isiko lokuxoxa indaba wedwa lisiza izingane ukuveza imizwa, ziphrakhthize ulimi nokuhlola imicabango ngokudlala nokwenza sengathi 💛

SourceText: It’s a beautiful, calming game rooted in traditional storytelling 🌙
text: Umdlalo omuhle, ozothile ogxile ekuxoxweni kwezinganekwane 🌙

SourceText: *Hopscotch Fun*
text: *Ubumnandi bokugxuma - gxuma ezikweleni*

SourceText: Let’s jump into a classic game! ☀️
text: Masigxumele kumdlalo wezikwele! ☀️

SourceText: 🔷 Draw a hopscotch grid on the ground using chalk, a stick in the sand, or even tape on the floor indoors. Number the squares from 1 to 9.
text: 🔷 Dweba izikwele phansi ngoshokhi, ngokhuni esihlabathini, noma iselothephi phansi endlini. Bhala izinamba ezikweleni ukusuka ku 1 kuya ku 9.

SourceText: 🔴 Give your child a small object (like a stone or bottle top) to toss into square 1.
text: 🔴 Nika ingane yakho into encane (njengetshe noma isivalo sebhodlela) ukuthi iyiphonse kwisikwele sokuqala.

SourceText: ⬆️ Then they hop through the squares on one foot—skipping the square with the marker—then turn around and come back.
text: ⬆️ Bese iyagxuma ezikweleni ngonyawo olulodwa - ijomba isikwele esimakiwe - bese iyajika ibuyele emuva.

SourceText: ⬇️ Stop to pick up the marker on the way back, still hopping!
text: ⬇️ Ima ukuze ucoshe imakha endleni ebuyayo, usagxuma!

SourceText: 🔄 Next round: throw the marker into square 2... and so on.
text: 🔄 Umzukiswano olandelayo: phonsa imakha esikweleni sesibili... njalo njalo.

SourceText: Hopscotch builds balance, counting, turn-taking, and fun movement skills. You can sing as you hop or make your own rules for extra challenge! 🎈
text: Ugxum- gxa wakha ibhalansi, ukubala, ukushintshana, namakhono omnyakazo ojabulisayo. Ungacula ngesikhathi ugxuma noma wenze imithetho yakho ukwenzela ukuthi kubenzinyana! 🎈

SourceText: *Pattern Discovery*
text: *Ukuthola Iphethini*

SourceText: Did you know that patterns are all around us? 🎨
text: Ubuwazi ukuthi amaphethini asizungezile? 🎨

SourceText: 🌷 Explore patterns together - whether it's the rows of palm trees outside or the design on their clothes.
text: 🌷 Hlolani amaphethini ndawonye - noma kungaba olayini bezihlahla zesundu noma idizayini ezimpahleni zayo.

SourceText: 🔷 Line up colourful blocks, rocks, or feathers, or draw a pattern using simple shapes. Ask your child questions like: “What comes next?’” or “Can you create your own pattern?”
text: 🔷 Beka ngolayini amabhloks amibalabala, amatshe noma izimpaphe noma udwebe amasheyiphu alula. Buza ingane yakho imibuzo enjengo: "Yini elandelayo?" noma "Ungakwazi ukwakha eyakho iphethini?"

SourceText: 🎉Remember to encourage and celebrate their curiosity as they explore the world of patterns!
text: 🎉 Khumbula ukuyigqugquzela nokuyijabulela ilukuluku layo ngenkathi ihlola umhlaba wamaphethini!

SourceText: Your child will start by noticing patterns, and before you know it, they will be copying and creating their own patterns! 📝
text: Ingane yakho izoqala ukuqaphela amaphethini, kungekudala, uzobe esekopela ukuzakhela awakhe amaphethini 📝

SourceText: Recognizing patterns helps prepare your child for future maths skills 💡
text: Ukuqaphela amaphethini kusiza ukulungiselela ingane ngamakhono ekusasa ezibalo 💡

SourceText: *Guess the Emotion*
text: *Qagela Umuzwa*

SourceText: 👀 Ask your child, “What does it look like when we’re happy? Angry? Surprised?”
text: 👀 Buza ingane yakho, "Kubukeka kanjani uma sijabule? Sithukuthele? Simangele?"

SourceText: 👂 Take turns acting out different emotions and guessing what the other person is feeling. Using a silly voice, you can explain different reasons why you are feeling that emotion.
text: 👂 Shintshanani ngokulingisa imizwa ehlukene niqagela ukuthi omunye umuntu uzizwa kanjani. Ukusebenzisa iphimbo elihlekisayo, ungachaza ukuthi kungani uzizwa ngaleyondlela.

SourceText: This isn’t just a game - it’s a chance for your child to learn how to recognize emotions in others 💚
text: Akusiwo umdlalo nje lona - ithuba lokuthi ingane yakho ifunde ukuqaphela imizwa kwabanye abantu 💚

SourceText: So, get ready to act out some emotions and
text: Manje lungela ukulingisa eminye imizwa futhi

SourceText: enjoy this special play activity together! 🌈
text: jabulela lomdlalo obalulekile ndawonye! 🌈

SourceText: *Picture Puzzle*
text: *Iphazili Yezithombe*

SourceText: Get ready to turn a picture into a fun jigsaw puzzle that boosts memory and direction skills! 🎨
text: Lungela ukushintsha isithombe sibe iphazili ehlanganisa izithombe lokho okukhulisa inkumbulo namakhono omhlahlandlela! 🎨

SourceText: 📝 You’ll need scissors and a picture from a paper or magazine - or a picture that you have drawn yourself.
text: 📝 Uzodinga isikele nesithombe esisephepheni noma kwimagazini - noma isithombe osidwebile wena.

SourceText: 💡 First, cut the picture into at least three pieces. Older children can try cutting up the pieces for younger children if they already know how to use scissors safely.
text: 💡 Qala ngokusika isithombe okungenani ophisi abathathu. Abadadlana bangazama ukusikela abancane uma bekwazi ukusebenzisa isikele ngokuphephile.

SourceText: 🔷 Now, flip the pieces face down so you can’t see the picture.
text: 🔷 Manje phendula labophisi ubabhekise phansi ukuze singabonakali isithombe.

SourceText: ✅ Your challenge? Rebuild the picture together by turning over one piece at a time and putting it back together.
text: ✅ Inselelo yakho? Phinda wakhe isithombe usihlanganise ngokuvula uphisi ngamunye ngesikhathi nokusihlanganisa.

SourceText: 👀 If your child needs a little help, ask guiding questions like, 'Where do you think this piece goes?'
text: 👀 Uma ingane yakho idinga usizo oluncane, buza imibuzo efana no "Ucabanga ukuthi lophisi ungenaphi?

SourceText: It’s a quick and fun way to strengthen memory and problem-solving skills! ✨
text: Kuyindlela esheshayo nejabulisayo yokuqinisa inkumbulo namakhono okusombulula inkinga! ✨

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/photo-puzzle
text: Iguqulwe kususelwa ku Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/photo-puzzle

SourceText: *Superhero Costume Raffle*
text: *Umncintiswano Wesudi Yeqhawe*

SourceText: You can transform into superheroes with this fun and imaginative dressing-up game! 👑
text: Ungashintsha ube iqhawe ngalomdlalo ojabulisayo nocabangisayo wokugqoka! 👑

SourceText: 2️⃣ Here’s what you’ll need: Two items of clothing for each person playing, and a pillowcase or bag to hold them.
text: 2️⃣ Nakhu ozokudinga: Izimpahla zokugqoka ezimbili zomuntu ngamunye odlalayo, isikhwama somcamelo noma isikhwama sokuphatha.

SourceText: 🎁 Start by placing all the clothes in the pillowcase.
text: 🎁 Qala ngokufaka zonke izimpahla esikhwameni somcamelo.

SourceText: 👀 Hand the pillowcase to the smallest player first. Make sure their eyes are shut, then let them pull out one item of clothing.
text: 👀 Nika umdlali omncane isikhwama somcamelo kuqala. Qinisekakisa ukuthi uwavalile amehlo, bese nimvumela akhiphe impahla ngayinye.

SourceText: 🔄 Next, pass the case around until everyone gets two items of clothing.
text: 🔄 Okulandelayo, dlulisela iskhwama somcamelo kuze kube wonke umuntu uthola izimpahla ezimbili.

SourceText: ✨ Now, everyone takes turns to imagine what superpower their pieces of clothing give them. Maybe a scarf makes you fly, or a hat gives you super speed - it’s totally up to your imagination!
text: ✨ Njengamanje, wonke umuntu uthatha ithuba lokucabanga ukuthi imaphi amandla abawathola ezimpahleni zabo. Mhlawumbe isikhafu esikwenza undize, noma isigqoko esikwenza ube nejubane kakhulu - kukumcabango wakho!

SourceText: 🚗 Now it’s time to play! Put on your superpower clothes and act out a story together, like saving the world from a monster.
text: 🚗 Isikhathi sokudlala manje! Gqoka izimpahla ezikupha amandla nilingise indaba ndawonye, njengokusindisa umhlaba kwinunu enkulu.

SourceText: It’s a fantastic way to encourage creative thinking, flexible language skills, and playful bonding 💛
text: Indlela enhle ukugqugquzela ukucabanga obunobuhlakani, ulimi oluguqugukayo nomdlalo oxhumanisayo 💛

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/superhero-costume-lottery
text: Iguqulwe kususelwa ku Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/superhero-costume-lottery

SourceText: *Letter Hunt*
text: *Ukuzingelwa KwamaAlfabhethi*

SourceText: Turn your home into a scavenger hunt with this fun and interactive letter game ✅
text: Phendula ikhaya lakho indawo yokufuna izinto ezilahlekile nomdlalo wokuhlanganyela wama-alfabhethi ✅

SourceText: 📝 Here is what you need: paper and a pen.
text: 📝 Nakhu okudingayo: iphepha nepeni.

SourceText: 1️⃣ Start by writing down each letter of the alphabet - one letter per piece of paper. Once you are done, place the papers face down so you can’t see the letters.
text: 1️⃣ Qala ngokubhala i-alfabhethi ngayinye - i-alfabhethi eyodwa ephepheni ngalinye. Uma usuqedile, beka amaphepha uwabhekise phansi ukuze ungakwazi ukubona ama- alfabhethi.

SourceText: 👀 Now, turn over one piece of paper to reveal a letter. The challenge? Find objects around your house that begin with that letter! Once you've found an item, place it next to the letter on the paper.
text: 👀 Manje usungaphendula iphepha ngalinye ukuze kuzovela i-alfabhethi. Inselelo? Thola izinto ekhaya lakho ezinegama eliqala ngaleyo alfabhethi! Uma uke wayithola into, ibeke eceleni kwe-alfabhethi esephepheni.

SourceText: 🔄 Keep the hunt going! Flip over the next letter and search for another object. Continue until you’ve gone through all the letters.
text: 🔄 Makuqhubeke ukuzingela! Phenya i-alfabhethi elandelayo bese ufuna enye into. Qhubeka uze uwabone wonke ama- alfabhethi.

SourceText: This activity is perfect for blending learning with active play, while giving your little ones a fun way to practise their alphabet and creativity! 💡
text: Lomsebenzi ulungele ukuhlanganisa isifundo nokudlala, ngesikhathi unika ingane yakho indlela enentokozo ukuthi aphrakthize ama-alfabhethi nobuhlakani! 💡

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/what-we-see
text: Iguqulwe kususelwa ku Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/what-we-see

SourceText: *Hot or cold*
text: *Kuyashisa noma Kuyabanda*

SourceText: Ready to hunt for hidden treasure using clues? 🎁
text: Ukulungele ukuzingela umkhondo womcebo ofihliwe? 🎁

SourceText: ⚽ Here’s what you’ll need: something easy to hide, like toys or balls.
text: ⚽ Nakhu ozokudinga: into ekulula ukuyifihla, njengethoyizi noma amabhola.

SourceText: 👀 One player hides an object, while the others close their eyes. The player who hid the object will now give clues to help the others find it.
text: 👀 Umdlali oyedwa ufihla into, ngesikhathi abanye bevale amehlo. Umdlali oyifihlile into uzobanika umkhondo abanye ukubasiza ukuthi bayithole.

SourceText: ☀️ When the person searching is getting close to where the object is hidden, the hider can say “getting warm!” or “hot!”, and when the searcher is going in the wrong direction, the hider can say “getting colder…”.
text: ☀️ Uma umuntu oseshayo esondela lapho kufihlwe khona, ofihlile angathi"Uyafudumala!" noma "kuyashisa", uma oseshayo eya ngasohlangothini okungafihliwe kulo, ofihlile angathi "kuyabanda".

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns hiding objects and giving clues - it’s fun for everyone to get involved!
text: 🔄 Shintshanani ngokufihla izinto nokunikana ngomkhondo- kujabulisa wonke umuntu uma bezibandakanya!

SourceText: 💡 For an extra challenge, hide multiple objects around the house and create a treasure map.
text: 💡 Okwenselelo eyengeziwe, fihlani izinto eziningi ekhaya nakhe imephu yomcebo.

SourceText: This fun-filled game is perfect for challenging problem-solving and communication skills while keeping everyone engaged with exciting clues! ✨
text: Lomdlalo ojabulisayo ulungele ukuxazulula izinkinga ezinkulu namakhono okuxoxisana ngenkathi wonke umuntu ezibandakanya ngemikhondo ojabulisayo! ✨

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/treasure-hunt
text: Kuguqulelwe kususelwa ku Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/treasure-hunt

SourceText: *Shine a Light*
text: *Khanyisa Ilambu*

SourceText: Let your creativity shine with shadow drawing! Here’s what you’ll need: pens, paper, and a light ▶️
text: Yenza ubuhlakani bakho buqhakaze ngomdwebo wesithunzi! Nakhu ozokudinga: amapeni, iphepha, nokukhanya ▶️

SourceText: 👀 Let your child choose an object that they would like to draw - it could be anything from around the house, like a cup or a favourite toy. 📝 Have them place the object upright on a blank sheet of paper.
text: 👀 Dedela ingane yakho ikhethe into efisa ukuyidweba - kungaba noma yini ekhona endlini, njengenkomishi noma ithoyizi lakhe eliyintandokazi📝 Yenze iyibeke lento iqonde ephepheni elingabhaliwe.

SourceText: 💡 Hold the light behind the object so the shadow appears on the paper. You can take turns holding the light, or rest it on something sturdy to keep your hands free for drawing.
text: 💡Khanyisela lento ngelambu ukuze isithunzi sayo sivele ephepheni. Ningashintshana ngokuphatha ilambu elikhanyayo, noma ulibeke entweni enganyakazi ukuze uphumuze izandla khona izandla zizokhululeka ukuze ukwazi ukudweba.

SourceText: 🎨 Now, guide your child so they can trace the shadow’s outline on the paper.
text: 🎨Manje siza ingane yakho ukuze akwazi ukudweba ilandela isithunzi esisephepheni.

SourceText: ✨ Once they have finished drawing the shape, it’s time to get creative! Colour and decorate the shadow together to add your own artistic touch.
text: ✨ Uma isiqedile ukudweba leyosheyiphu, sekuyisikhathi sokuveza ubuhlakani! Ukufaka umbala nihlobise isithunzi ndawonye ukwengeza ubuchwepheshe.

SourceText: 📖 For extra fun, make up a story about the shadow object together as you decorate. What is it doing today?
text: 📖Ukuze nijabule ngokwengeziwe, qamba indaba ngesithunzi sento nisahlobisa ndawonye. Yenzani namhlanje?

SourceText: This activity is a fun and imaginative way to boost creativity and flexible thinking while exploring shadows and light 🌈
text: Lomsebenzi uyajabulisa futhi uyacabangisa ukugquqguzela ubuciko nokuguqula umcabango ngenkathi nihlola izithunzi nokukhanya 🌈

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/shine-a-light
text: Iguqulwe kususelwa ku Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/shine-a-light

SourceText: *Colour Hunt*
text: *Ukuzingela Umbala*

SourceText: Get ready for a colourful adventure that will challenge your child’s thinking and focus 🎨
text: Lungela ukba nohambo olumibalabala okuzokwenza ingane yakho icabange futhi igxile 🎨

SourceText: 5️⃣ Gather 5 small objects with different colours (like crayons, building blocks or anything else you have in the house).
text: 5️⃣Qoqa izinto ezincane ezinhlanu ezinemibala ehlukene( njengama khrayoni, amabloks okwakha noma yini enye ekhona endlini).

SourceText: 🎁 Place all the coloured objects in a bag. Each participant picks one object from the bag to get started.
text: 🎁 Faka zonke izinto ezinombala esikhwameni. Umuntu ngamunye ukhetha into eyodwa esikhwameni ukuzoqala.

SourceText: 👀 Now, the challenge begins! Each player must find three other objects around the house that are the same colour as the object they picked. Search everywhere for the perfect matches!
text: 👀 Inselelo iyaqala manje! Umdlali ngamunye kumele athole izinto ezintathu khona endlini ezifanayo ngombala, njengoba bezicoshile lezinto. Sesha yonke indawo ukuthola ezimesha nazo!

SourceText: 🚩 When a player finds an object that matches the colour, they place it next to the object and shout "match!"
text: Uma umdlali ethola into emesha nombala, bayibeka eduze kwento bamemeze ukuthi "mesh!"

SourceText: 🔄 Once a player has found three matching objects, they can head back to the bag, choose another colour, and start the hunt all over again!
text: 🔄 Uma umdlali esethole izinto ezintathu ezimeshayo, angabuyela esikhwameni, akhethe omunye umbala, aqale azingele futhi!

SourceText: Colour Hunt is a fantastic way to boost focus, encourage problem-solving, and keep everyone moving and engaged. Let the colourful treasure hunt begin! ✅
text: Ukuzingela umbala indlela enhle yokukhuthaza ukugxila, ukugqugquzela ukusombulula izinkinga nokwenza wonke umuntu anyakaze futhi azibandakanye. Makuqale ukuzingela ubucebi bemibala! ✅

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/colour-hunt
text: Iguqulwe ku Ukufunda Ngokudlala: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/colour-hunt

SourceText: *Round & Round*
text: *Umjikelezo no Mjikelezo*

SourceText: 👋 Grab each other’s hands and form a circle.
text: 👋 Bambanani ngezandla nenze isikokela.

SourceText: 🎵 Walk round and round while you sing a song you know – it could be one from your childhood like “Ring-a-Rosy” or “Sawa Sonke”, or a favourite your child loves.
text: 🎵 Hambani nenze isikokela ngenkathi nicula ingoma eniyaziyo - kungaba enye yangezikhathi nisebanane njengo "Ring-a-Rosy" noma "Sawa Sonke" noma ethandwa ingane yakho.

SourceText: 🎉 As you go round, add some silly moves to make it even more fun. Try hopping on one leg, see if you can put your leg over the next person’s arm, or gently fall to the ground when the song finishes.
text: 🎉 Ngenkathi nizungeza, ningangeza umnyakazo ohlekisayo ukwenzela ukuthi kube nokujabula okwengeziwe. Zamani ukugxuma ngonyawo olulodwa, ubone ukuthi ungakwazi ukubeka umlenze wakho ngaphezu kwengalo yomunye umuntu noma uwele phansi ngokuzolile uma ingoma iphela.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns choosing the next move or song!
text: 🔄 Shintshanani ngokukhetha umnyakazo noma ingoma elandelayo!

SourceText: This activity builds connection, encourages coordination and balance, and sparks lots of laughter and creativity 😃
text: Lomsebenzi wakha ukuxhumana, ukugqugquzela ukuxhumanisa nokubhalansisa nokwenza kube nookuhleka nobuhlakani 😃

SourceText: *Freeze Like a Statue*
text: *Nqabela njengensika*

SourceText: 👀 Let your child shape you into a frozen statue - you might be a tree, a happy, sad or angry person, or anything else they imagine!
text: 👀 Dedela ingane yakho ikubumbe njengesithombe esinganyakazi - ungaba isihlahla, ejabulile, dabukisayo noma umuntu othukuthele noma yini enye abayicabangayo!

SourceText: 🚩 You can even invite others to join and let your child shape you all into a frozen scene, like a classroom, a soccer match, or something completely silly.
text: 🚩 Ungamema nabanye bajoyine nidedele ingane yakho inibumbe nonke ukuba izithombe ezinganyakazi, njenge kilasi, umdlalo webhola lezinyawo, noma yini ehlekisayo.

SourceText: 📱 Once the statue is ready, your child can be the ‘photographer’ and take a pretend (or real!) picture.
text: 📱 Uma umfanekiso onganyakazi usulungile, ingane yakho ingaba umthwebuli wezithombe futhi angenza sengathi isithombe sangempela (noma isithombe sangempela!).

SourceText: 🔄 Then swap roles and let them be the statue next.
text: 🔄 Bese nishintshana ngendima umdedele naye abe isithombe esinganyakazi.

SourceText: This activity encourages creativity, role-play, and imagination - while building confidence through leading and observing ⭐
text: Lomsebenzi ugqugquzela ubuhlakani, ukulingisa nomcabango - ngaleso sikhathi wakha ukuzethemba ngokuhola nokubuka ⭐

SourceText: *Peg and Pretend*
text: *Wenze sengathi Isikhonkwane*

SourceText: Get creative with easy household items! 🧸
text: Dala ngezinto zasekhaya! 🧸

SourceText: 👋 Grab 10 clothing pegs – or more if you have – and build a shape by pegging them together. Let your child build their own creation too!
text: 👋 Thatha amaphegs awu- 10 - noma amaningi uma unawo - nakhe isheyiphu ngokuwahlanganisa. Dedela ingane yakho yakhe okwayo!

SourceText: 🎨 Ask your child what their shape could be. A bug? A spaceship? A crocodile? Act out a little story using the peg creations.
text: 🎨 Buza ingane yakho ukuthi ingab iyiphi isheyiphu yayo. Imbungulu? Umkhumbi? Ingwenya? Lingisa indaba encane usebenzise okwakhiwe ngamaphegs.

SourceText: 🔄 Then build something new and let the next story begin!
text: 🔄 Bese nakha into entsha bese niqala indaba entsha!

SourceText: Did you know that these imagination games help your child develop thinking, creativity, fine motor skills, and hand-eye coordination? All from a few simple pegs and a lot of imagination! 💡
text: Bewazi ukuthi lemidlalo yemcabango isiza ingane yakho ukuthuthukisa ukucabanga, ubuhlakani, amakhono okuphila, nokuxhumana kwehlo nesandla? Konke lokhu ngenxa yamaphegs nemicabango! 💡

SourceText: Adapted from UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yYt2ziDgvRI
text: Iguqulwe kwibhokisi lokudlala lakwa UNICEF: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yYt2ziDgvRI

SourceText: *Wind Power*
text: *Amandla Omoya*

SourceText: Let’s explore the magic of wind with a fun movement game! ✨
text: Ake sihlole umlingo womoya ngomdlalo wokunyakaza! ✨

SourceText: 👀 First, talk with your child about the wind. Can you see it? Taste it? How does it feel on your hair or your skin?
text: 👀 Qala, ngokukhuluma nengane yakho ngomoya. Uyawubona? Uwunambithe? Uzwakala kanjani ezinweleni noma esikhumbeni?

SourceText: 🔶 Take a piece of card or a leaf, close your eyes, and blow it using your own wind power. Watch how it moves!
text: 🔶 Thatha isqephu sekhadi noma ihlamvu. vala amehlo, futhi uwuphephethe usebenzise awakho amandla omoya. Buka ukuthi unyakaza kanjani!

SourceText: 🔵 Now try heavier things. Can you blow a spoon or small stones? What’s different?
text: 🔵 Zama izinto ezisindayo. Ungakwazi ukuphephetha isipuni noma amatshe amancane? Yini ehlukile?

SourceText: 🎨 Time to play with water and wind! Drop small amounts of water on a plate or piece of plastic. Blow the water gently across the surface - you can make a straw to blow through by rolling up a small piece of paper.
text: 🎨 Isikhathi sokudlala ngamanzi nomoya! Chitha amanzi amancane epuleyitini noma kupulastiki. Phephethela amanzi phansi - ungazenzela istro ngokugoqa iphepha uphephethe ngaso.

SourceText: 🏆 You can even place objects and try blowing the water around them to trace their shape.
text: 🏆Ungabeka izinto uzame ukuphephetha amanzi ezizungezile ukulandela isheyiphi yazo.

SourceText: This sensory activity helps your child understand movement, space, and airflow - while sparking creativity and laughter 💡
text: Lomsebenzi wemizwa usiza ingane yakho ukuthi iqonde umnyakazo, indawo nokungena komoya - ngesikhathi evusa ubuhlakani futhi ehleka 💡

SourceText: Adapted from UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=COZu4eJltow
text: Iguqulwe kwibhokisi lokudlala lakwa UNICEF: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=COZu4eJltow

SourceText: *Blanket Forts*
text: *Indawo Ethokomele*

SourceText: Let’s dive into creating your very own cosy hideaway! 🧸
text: Masiqale ukwakha indawo yakho yokucasha ethokomele! 🧸

SourceText: 👋 First, gather everything you’ll need - blankets, pillows, chairs, and maybe even a table. If you want to add a little magic, grab a light to light up your fort.
text: 👋 Qala ngokuqoqa konke ozokudinga - ingubo yokulala, imicamelo, izihlalo mhlawumbe netafula. Uma ufuna ukungeza umlingo, thatha ilambu ukukhanyisa indawo yokuthokomala.

SourceText: 🔷 Now, it’s time to build. Start by setting up two chairs facing each other, or use a table as the main structure of your fort.
text: 🔷Manje isikhathi sokwakha. Qala ngokusetha izihlalo ezimbili uzibeke zibhekane noma usebenzise itafula njengesisekelo sendawo ethokomele.

SourceText: 👋 Drape the blankets over the chairs or table to create a roof. Don’t forget to secure them - use clothing pegs or something heavy to hold everything in place so your fort stays strong!
text: 👋Ndlala izingubo phezu kwezihlalo noma itafula ukwakha uphahla. Ungakhohlwa ukuthi ziphephe - sebenzisa amapegs ezimpahla noma into esindayo ukuze kubambeke ziqine!

SourceText: 🔴 Next, make the inside extra comfy with pillows or blankets.
text: 🔴Yenza ingaphakathi libe ntofontofo ngemicamelo noma izingubo zokulala.

SourceText: 🎈 Once your fort is built, add some fun touches. Ask your child to bring their favourite toys or books, and decorate the space however you like.
text: 🎈Uma indawo yokuthokomala isiyakhiwe, nezezela okujabulisayo okokugcina. Cela ingane yakho ilethe amathoyizi nezincwadi ezithandayo nihlobise leyondawo ngendlela enithanda ngayo.

SourceText: 📝 You could even make a “welcome” sign together to make it feel like your very own special house!
text: 📝 Ningenza ngisho umbhalo "wamukelekile" ndawonye ukuze kuzwakale njengendlu yenu ebalulekile!

SourceText: 🌙 Now, crawl inside and enjoy your new fort! This is your cosy, creative space for reading stories, playing games, or just spending some quiet time together.
text: 🌙 Ungakhasa ngaphakathi ujabulele indawo yokuthokomala entsha! Le indawo ethokomele, indawo yobuhlakani yokufunda izindaba, ukudlala imidlalo noma indawo yokuchitha isikhathi esinokuthula ndawonye.

SourceText: Building a blanket fort is more than just a fun activity - it’s a chance to spark creativity, solve problems, and share special moments together. So, grab those blankets and start building your adventure today! 💡
text: Ukwakha indawo ngengubo yokulala kungaphezu komsebenzi ojabulisayo - isikhathi sokukhuthaza ubuhlakani, ukuxazulula izinkinga, nokuchitha isikhathi esibalulekile ndawonye nokuqala ukwakha uhambo namhlanje! 💡

SourceText: *Tricky Tower*
text: *Umbhoshongo Okhohlisayo*

SourceText: Here is an exciting activity that will test your child’s ability to estimate risks, work as a team, and think creatively - all while having fun and developing fine motor skills ⭐
text: Nawu umsebenzi ojabulisayo ozohlola ikhono lengane yakho lokuhlola ingozi, ukusebenzisana, nokucabanga ngobuhlakani - ngesikhathi ijabule nokuthuthukisa amakhono okuphila ⭐

SourceText: 🔶 Start by giving your child building blocks or something else they can stack.
text: 🔶 Qala ngokunika ingane yakho izitini zokwakha noma enye into abangenza ngayo isitaki.

SourceText: 👋 Ask them to build a tower by stacking the blocks, using just one hand. This challenge helps build focus and concentration as they balance the blocks carefully.
text: 👋 Yicele ukuthiy akhe umbhoshongo ngokutaka izitini, esebenzisa isandla esisodwa. Lenselelo isiza ukwakha ukugxila njengoba ibhalansisa izitini ngokucophelela.

SourceText: ⬆️ If other children or adults are around, you can make it into a match to see who can build the tallest tower the fastest.
text: ⬆️ Uma kukhona ezinye izingane noma abantu abadala eduzane, ungayenza kube umncintiswano ukubona ukuthi ngubani ongakha umbhoshongo omude kuneminye ngokushesha.

SourceText: 🔄 Make the game even more challenging by asking your child to using their non-dominant hand. They’ll have to balance their wish to build the tallest tower with the risk of the tower collapsing.
text: 🔄 Yenza umdlalo ube nzinyana ngokuthi ucele ingane yakho ukuthi isebenzise isandla esingenawo amandla. Kumele ibhalansise isifiso sokwakha umbhoshongo omude kunobungozi bokuthi ungawa umbhoshongo.

SourceText: This isn’t just about building - it’s about problem-solving, persistence, and teamwork 💛
text: Lokhu akukhona ngokwakha nje - kungokuxazulula inkinga, ukuphikelela, nokusebenzisana 💛

SourceText: Tricky Tower is a fantastic way to help your child develop important skills while having fun with friends or family 🏆
text: Umbhoshongo okhohlisayo indlela enhle kakhulu ukusiza ingane yakho ukuthuthukisa amakhono abalulekile ngesikhathi ijabula nabangani noma umndeni 🏆

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/tricky-tower
text: Iguqulwe kususwa ku Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/tricky-tower

SourceText: *Flip the blanket*
text: *Phendula ingubo*

SourceText: Can you and your child flip a blanket while standing on it? 🚩
text: Ungakwazi wena nengane yakho ukuphendula ingubo ngesikhathi nimi phezu kwayo 🚩

SourceText: ⬇️ Start by laying a blanket or large piece of cloth flat on the ground. Have all the players stand on the blanket - make sure no one steps off!
text: ⬇️ Qala ngokubeka ingubo yokulala phezu kwendwangu phansi. Abadlali bonke bame phezu kwengubo - wenze isiqiniseko sokuthi akekho onyathela eceleni!

SourceText: 👋 Now, the challenge begins. The players must work together to flip the blanket over without stepping off or touching the ground.
text: 👋 Inselelo iyaqala manje. Abadlali kumele basebenzisane ukuphendula ingubo ngaphandle kokunyathela eceleni noma ukuthinta phansi.

SourceText: 🔑 Experiment with different ideas, try new strategies, and see what works best!
text: 🔑 Zama imibono ehlukene, zama amaqhinga amasha, ubone ukuthi ikuphi okusebenza kangcono!

SourceText: 🔄 If anyone touches the ground, no worries - just start over and give it another try.
text: 🔄 Uma kukhona othinta phansi, ayikho inkinga - qala phansi uzame futhi.

SourceText: 👀 While you are playing, talk about the problem-solving you are doing. Ask the players what ideas they are trying and why, how they are working together, and what is working and what is not. Discuss how they came up with solutions as a team.
text: 👀 Ngesikhathi udlala, khuluma ngokuxazulula inkinga lokhu okwenzayo. Buza abadlali ukuthi iyiphi imibono abayizamayo nokuthi kungobani, basebenzisana kanjani ndawonye. ikuphi okusebenzayo nokuthi ikuphi okungasebenzi. Xoxani ngokuthi baqhamuke kanjani nesisombululo njengeqembu.

SourceText: Flip the Blanket is a fantastic way to encourage teamwork, creative thinking, problem solving, and perseverance - all while having a great time together! 🎉
text: Ukuphendula ingubo indlea enhle kakhulu yokugqugquzela ukusebenzisana, ukucabanga ngobuhlakani, ukusombulula inkinga nokubekezela - konke ngesikhathi bedlala umdlalo omuhle kakhulu ndawonye! 🎉

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/flip-the-blanket
text: Iguqulwe ku Ukufunda Ngokudlala: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/flip-the-blanket

SourceText: *Can You Catch It?*
text: *Ungayibamba?*

SourceText: Let’s see if you can follow instructions while catching a ball! ⚽
text: Ake sibone ukuthi ungayilandela imiyalelo ngesikhathi ubamba ibhola! ⚽

SourceText: ✅ Start by standing about three metres apart and gently throw a ball at each other. After a few easy throws, it’s time to introduce the rules!
text: ✅ Qalani ngokuma niqhelelane amamitha amathathu bese niphoselana ibhola ngobumnene. Ngemuva kokuphoselana kalula, manje isikhathi sokwethula imithetho!

SourceText: 1️⃣ When the thrower shouts ‘one’, the catcher has to catch the ball with their right hand and put their left foot out.
text: 1️⃣ Uma ophonsayo ememeza ethi 'one' onqakayo kumele anqake ibhola ngesandla sokudla abeke unyawo lwakhe lwesinxele ngaphandle.

SourceText: 2️⃣ If the thrower shouts ‘two’, the catcher catches with their left hand and puts their right foot out.
text: 2️⃣ Uma ophonsayo ememeza ethi 'thu' onqakayo kumele anqake ibhola ngesandla sesinxele abeke unyawo lwakhe lwesokudla ngaphandle.

SourceText: ⭐ Once you’re confident, add some extra numbers and rules!
text: ⭐ Uma usuzethemba, ungangeza ezinye izinamba neminye imithetho!

SourceText: ⏰ For the game to work, make sure the number is called before you throw the ball, so the catcher has time to react!
text: ⏰ Ukuze umdlalo uhambe kahle, qiniseka ukuthi inamba ibizwa ngaphambi kokuphonsa ibhola, ukuze ozonqaka abe nesikhathi sokuphendula!

SourceText: 🚩 You can adjust the rules to make it perfect for every age.
text: 🚩 Ungakwazi ukulungisa imithetho ukuze ilungele abantu bayo yonke iminyaka.

SourceText: This activity is a great way to improve coordination, concentration, and quick thinking - all while having fun! So, grab a ball and start throwing with these new rules to test your skills! 💡
text: Lomsebenzi indlela enhle yokuthuthukisa ukuxhumanisa, ukucabangisisa nokucabanga ngokushesha - konke lokhu ngokuzijabulisa! Manje, bamba ibhola uqale ukuliphonsa ngalemithetho emisha ukuhlola amakhono akho! 💡

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/can-you-catch-it
text: Iguqulwe ku Ukufunda Ngokudlala: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/can-you-catch-it

SourceText: *Unseen Guesses*
text: *Ukuqagela Okungabonakali*

SourceText: You can do this activity when you are together with at least three people in total 3️⃣
text: Lomsebenzi ungawenza uma nindawonye okungenani nibe bathathu uma niphelele 3️⃣

SourceText: 👀 Ask your child and another child/adult to sit next to each other. Blindfold both using a scarf or hat.
text: 👀 Cela ingane yakho nenye ingane/umuntu omdala ukuthi bahlale eduzane komunye. Bavale amehlo bobabili ngesikhafu noma isigqoko.

SourceText: 🚗 Give your child an object and ask them to feel it and describe it, without saying the name of the object!
text: 🚗 Nika ingane yakho into umubuze ukuthi ayizwe bese eyayichaza, ngaphandle kokusho igama laleyonto!

SourceText: 🎁 The other person’s job is to figure out what the object is based on the description.
text: 🎁 Umsebenzi womunye umuntu ukuthola ukuthi iyini leyonto ekwincazelo.

SourceText: ✅ The “guesser” can ask questions, but the “speaker” can only answer with "yes" or "no".
text: ✅ Oqagelayo angabuza imibuzo, kodwa okhulumayo angaphendula ngo "yebo" noma "cha".

SourceText: 🔄 After each round, swap roles and play again, giving everyone a chance to be the “speaker” and “guesser” and the one to provides the object.
text: 🔄 Ngemuva komzukiswano, shintshanani niqhubeke nokudlala, ninikana ithuba lokuthi omunye abe isikhulumi bese omunye abe onikezana ngento.

SourceText: This game is not only fun but also helps children develop strong communication skills and teaches them how to work together to achieve a goal. Enjoy working through the challenge of Unseen Guesses! 💚
text: Lomdlalo akusiwo owokujabula kuphela kodwa uphinde usize izingane ukuthuthukisa amakhono okuxhumana nokuzi fundisa ukusebenzisana ekuphumeleliseni inhloso. Kujabulele ukusebenzisana zidlule kwinselele yoku Qagela Okungabonakali! 💚

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/unseen-guesses
text: Iguqulwe kususwa ku Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/unseen-guesses

SourceText: *Things that Make Me Happy*
text: *Izinto Ezingijabulisayo*

SourceText: Let’s take some time to appreciate the little things that make us feel happy every day 😃
text: Make sithathe ithuba sibonge izinto ezincane ezisijabulisayo zonke izinsuku 😃

SourceText: 💛 Start by talking with your child about the things that made you happy today. It could be anything - a friend, a favourite pet, an activity that made you smile.
text: 💛 Qala ngokukhuluma nengane yakho ngezinto ezikujabulisile namhlanje. Kungaba noma yini - umngani, isilwane sasekhaya esiyintandokazi, into oyenzile, yakumamathekisa.

SourceText: 👀 Next, find three things that represent what makes you happy and place them in a special container or box.
text: 👀 Okulandelayo thola izinto ezintathu ezikhombisa ukuthi yini ekujabulisile bese uzifakaesitsheni noma ebhokisini elibalulekile.

SourceText: 🎨 If the things that make you happy are too big to fit in the box, or if you can’t find something to represent them, you can draw them!
text: 🎨 Uma lezinto ezikujabulisayo zinkulu kakhulu ukuthi zanele ebhokisini noma ungayitholi into ekhombisa lokho, ungazidweba!

SourceText: 👂 Once everything is in the box, discuss what you and your child chose. Ask them why these things make them happy. It’s a great way to get them talking about positive emotions.
text: 👂 Uma yonke into isisebhokisini khuluma ukuthi nikhethani nengane yakho. Yibuze ukuthi kungani lezinto ziyijabulisa. Indlela enhle yokubenza bakhulume ngemizwa emihle.

SourceText: You can play this game as often as you like - even daily! Doing this before bed can help your child stay motivated, happy, and calm, especially during tough times.
text: Ungawudlala lomdlalo noma ikangakhi - noma kungaba nsuku zonke! Ukwenza lokhu ngaphambi kokulala kungasiza ingane yakho ukukhuthazeka, ijabule nokuzotha, kakhulu ngezikhathi ezinzima.

SourceText: So, gather those happy things and create a special box full of joy! ⭐
text: Qoqa lezo zinto ezijabulisayo futhi wakhe ibhokisi eligcwele intokozo! ⭐

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/things-that-make-me-happy
text: Iguqulwe ku Ukufunda Ngokudlala: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/things-that-make-me-happy

SourceText: *Nature Game*
text: *Umdlalo Wemvelo*

SourceText: Let’s have some fun exploring the world around you with a nature-themed game! You can play it anywhere - at the beach, around your house, or even on a walk 🌷
text: Ake sijabule ngokuhlola umhlaba okuzungezile ngomdlalo wesihloko sendalo! Ungawudlala noma ikuphi - olwandle, ekhaya noma uthi ukuhamba 🌷

SourceText: 📝 First, draw a grid of 3 by 3 on a piece of paper and write something in each box that you might find in nature - like a tree, flower, rock, bird, or cloud.
text: 📝 Qala ngokudweba izikwele ezi 3 uphundwe ngo 3 ephepheni bese ubhala okuthile ongakuthola kwindalo kwisikwele ngasinye - njenge sihlahla, imbali, idwala, inyoni noma ifu.

SourceText: 👀 Now, it’s time to explore! Head outside and start searching for the items on your card.
text: 👀 Manje isikhathi sokuhlola! Phumela phandle uqale ukusesha izinto ezisekhadini.

SourceText: ✅ Each time you find something, mark it off.
text: ✅ Njalo uma kukhona okutholayo, kumake.

SourceText: 🏆 You decide when you win! Maybe it’s when you’ve marked off a whole line, or perhaps when you’ve found everything on your card. It’s completely up to you!
text: 🏆 Uyazinqumela ukuthi uwina nini! Mhlawumbe uma usuwuphawulile wonke ulayini, noma mhlawumbe usuthole konke okusekhadini. Kukuwena!

SourceText: Nature Game is a great way for your child to explore the outdoors, boost concentration, and have fun while learning more about the world around them. So, get outside and start your nature game! 🌱
text: Umdlalo wemvelo indlela enhle yokuhlola ingaphandle, ukukhulisa ukuqaphela, nokujabula ngesikhathi efunda kabanzi ngomhlaba omzungezile. Phumela phandle bese uqala owakho umdlalo wemvelo! 🌱

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/nature-bingo
text: Iguqulwe kususwa ku Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/nature-bingo

SourceText: *Baking Time*
text: *Isikhathi Sokubhaka*

SourceText: Baking isn’t just about creating something delicious - it’s a fun and exciting way to learn new skills while exploring creativity 🍞
text: Ukubhaka akusikho ukwenza into emnandi - indlela ejabulisayo yokufunda amakhono amasha okuhlola ubuhlakani 🍞

SourceText: From mixing to serving, your young chef will feel a sense of pride and accomplishment as they bring their tasty creations to life! ⭐
text: Ukusukela ekuxoveni kuya ekuphakeni, umpheki wakho omncane uzozizwa enokuziqhenya nempumelelelo uma okumnandi akwakhile kuyikho ngempela! ⭐

SourceText: 📖 Here’s how to get started: Pick a simple recipe, like bread or cookies.
text: 📖 Nansi indlela yokuqala: Khetha iresiphu elula, njenge sinkwa noma amakhekhe.

SourceText: 👋 Let your child help with all the steps - mixing ingredients, whisking the batter, and stirring everything together.
text: 👋 Vumela ingane yakho ikulekelele ngazo zonke izinyathelo - izithako zokuxova, ukushaya ibhotela, nokugoqoza uhlanganise konke ndawonye.

SourceText: 🎨 If you are making bread or cookies, invite your child to make shapes with the dough. Don’t be afraid to get messy!
text: 🎨 Uma wenza isinkwa noma amakhekhe, mema ingane yakho yenze amasheyiphi ngenhlama. Ungesabi ukungcola!

SourceText: 🚩 Once your treats are baking, the fun continues with cleaning up the mess!
text: 🚩 Uma amakhekhe ebhakwa, injabulo iyaqhubeka yokuhlanza ukungcola!

SourceText: ✅ Once your goodies are ready, let your children take over again make the food look nice and serve it.
text: ✅ Uma okumnandi sekulungile, dedela izingane ziphathe futhi zenze ukudla kubukeke kahle baphake.

SourceText: 😃 Finally, enjoy the results together!
text: 😃 Okokugcina, jabulelani umphumela ndawonye!

SourceText: You will have delicious food AND you’ll also have shared a special bonding moment while developing important skills like patience, focus, and creativity.
text: Nizoba nokudla okumnandi FUTHI nizobe nikwazile ukuba nesikhathi esibalulekile sobudlelwane ngesikhathi nithuthukisa amakhono abalulekile njengokubekezela, ukugxila nobuhlakani.

SourceText: So, grab what you need and let the baking fun begin! ✨
text: Thatha okudingayo bese uvumela injabulo iqale ✨

SourceText: *Secret Handshake*
text: *Ukuxhawula Okuyimfihlo*

SourceText: Let’s make a special, fun, and unique handshake that only you and your child share 👋
text: Masenze kube okukhethekile, kujabulise nokuxhawula okukhethekile okwenziwa uwena nengane yakho 👋

SourceText: 🔶 First, sit down together and talk about the kind of handshake you want. Should it be quick and silly, or cool and complicated? It’s totally up to you!
text: 🔶 Kuqala, hlalani phansi ndawonye nikhulume ngenhlobo zokuxhawula enizifunayo. Kumele kusheshe, kuhlekise, futhi kube nobunzinyana? Kukuwenina!

SourceText: 🎵 You can start by choosing a few simple moves like clapping patterns, high fives, fist bumps, or snapping fingers.
text: 🎵 Ungaqala ngokukhetha iminyakazo embalwa elula njengephethini yokushaya izandla, high five, ukuthintana ngenqupha noma ukuqhafaza iminwe.

SourceText: 🔄 Next, practice adding different steps. Maybe a spin, a shoulder tap, or even a fun dance move. The more creative and playful, the better!
text: 🔄 Asinenezele ezinye izitebhu ezihlukene ngokulandelayo. Mhlawumbe ukujikeleza, ukuthintana ehlombe, noma umdanso ohlekisayo. Uma siqhubeka nokwakha nokudlala, kuba ngcono!

SourceText: 💛 Once you’ve mastered your moves, make your secret handshake a part of your routine! Use it as a fun greeting after school, or anytime you want to feel that special connection.
text: 💛 Uma usuwenza kahle umnyakazo wenu, yenzani ukuxhawula okuyimfihlo kube ingxenye yesejwayelo sakho. Isebenzise njengendlela ejabulisayo yokubingelela ngemuva kokuphuma kwesikole, noma inini uma ufuna umuzwa obalulekile wokuxhumana.

SourceText: This isn’t just about having fun - it helps build your child’s confidence and teamwork skills while creating a special tradition you both can enjoy. ✅
text: Lokhu akukhona okokujabulisa - kuyasiza ukwakha ukuzethemba enganeni yakho namakhono okusebenzisana ngesikhathi nakha isiko elibalulekile eningalijabulela nobabili ✅

SourceText: *Create Silly Characters*
text: *Yakha Abalingisi Abahlekisayo*

SourceText: 🎨 All you need to play this game is a piece of paper and a pen or pencil.
text: 🎨 Okudingayo ukudlala lomdlalo isiqephu sephepha nepeni noma ipensela.

SourceText: 1️⃣ The first person draws the top (head, hat, hair) of a character. This can be as serious or silly as you want it to be.
text: 1️⃣ Umuntu wokuqala ozodweba isingaphezulu (ikhanda, isigqoko, izinwele) zomlingisi. Lokhu kungaba okwangempela noma kuhlekise ngalendlela ofuna ngayo.

SourceText: 🔄 Fold the drawing to cover up what has been drawn but leave two lines to show where the next person who is drawing should pick up.
text: 🔄 Goqa umdwebo ukuze umboze okudwetshiwe kodwa ushiye olayini ababili ukukhombisa ukuthi umuntu olandelayo ukudweba abone ukuthi kumele aqale kuphi.

SourceText: 2️⃣ Pass the paper on to the next person, who, without seeing what has already been drawn, will contribute the next set of features to the character: The shoulders or tummy. Fold the paper back to cover up the image and pass it on.
text: 2️⃣ Dlulisela iphepha kumuntu olandelayo, ongabonanga ukuthi sekudwetshwe ini, azonezezela kokulandelayo kumlingisi: Amahlombe noma isisu. Goqa iphepha ukuze umboze osekudwetshiwe bese uyalidlulisa.

SourceText: 📝 Repeat until someone has drawn the feet of the character and then open your drawing up to see the masterpiece you have created together!
text: 📝 Phindani kuze kubekhona ozodweba izinyawo zomlingisi bese niyawuvula umdwebo ukuze nibone ubuciko enibakhile ndawonye!

SourceText: This game builds creativity, nurtures imagination, and helps teach kids to collaborate – while having lots of laughs! 🌈
text: Lomdlalo wakha ubuhlakani, ukhulisa umcabango, nokusiza ukufundisa izingane ukuthi zibambisane - ngesikhathi behleka kakhulu! 🌈

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/co-drawing
text: Iguqulwe kususelwa ku Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/co-drawing

SourceText: Get ready to put your animal knowledge to the test in this exciting guessing game! 🚩
text: Lungela ukuhlola ulwazi lwakho ngezilwane kulomdlalo omnandi wokuqagela! 🚩

SourceText: 🧸 One person secretly picks an animal - don’t say which animal you’ve chosen!
text: 🧸 Oyedwa ukhetha isilwane engabonwa - ungasho ukuthi isiphi osikhethile!

SourceText: 💡 The other player asks questions to figure it out. You might ask, “Is the animal a mammal?” or “Can it fly?” Keep going until you guess correctly and then switch.
text: 💡 Omunye umdlali ubuza imibuzo ukuzama ukuthola impendulo. Ungabuza, "Ngabe isilwane esiphilayo?" noma "Ingabe siyandiza" Qhubeka uze uqagele okuyikho bese niyashintshana.

SourceText: 🔄 You can even play this game with multiple people by taking turns guessing and picking the animal!
text: 🔄 Ungawudlala lomdlalo nabantu abaningi nilokhu nishintshana ukuqagela nokukhetha isilwane!

SourceText: 👂 For added fun, younger kids can join by acting out the animal to give extra clues!
text: 👂 Ukwengeza ubumnandi, izingane ezincane zingajoyina nazo bazolingisa isilwane ukunika umkhondo othe xaxa!

SourceText: This game sharpens your child’s reasoning skills and strengthens their memory while having fun ⭐
text: Lomdlalo ucijisa amakhono okucabanga enganeni yakho, amakhono aqinisa inkumbulo ngesikhathi bejabule ⭐

SourceText: *A friendly chat*
text: *Ingxoxo yobungane*

SourceText: Talk to your teen about something that they are interested in! 😃
text: Khuluma nengane yakho ngokuthile enentshisekelo kukho! 😃

SourceText: ⚽ An easy way to start talking to your teen is to ask them about something they are interested in. For example, you could talk about sports, books, movies, friends, music, celebrities, or school.
text: ⚽ Indlela elula yokuqala ukukhuluma nengane yakho ukuyibuza ngokuthile inentshisekelo kukho. Isibonelo, ungakhuluma ngezemidlalo, izincwadi, amamuvi, abangani, umculo, osaziwayo, noma isikole.

SourceText: 👂 You may not find everything your teen shares to be interesting, but it’s important to show enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn.
text: 👂 Ungase ungatholi yonke into ingane yakho eyabelana ngayo ithandeka, kodwa kubalulekile ukukhombisa umdlandla kanye nokulangazelela ukufunda.

SourceText: *Create your own Recipe*
text: *Yenza eyakho iresiphi *

SourceText: Let your teen come up with a new meal idea!
text: Vumela ingane yakho ukuthi ize nombono omusha wokudla!

SourceText: 🍚 Create a new dish with @fields.child_nickname using ingredients they love!
text: 🍚 Yenza isidlo esisha ngegama elithi @fields.child_nickname usebenzisa izithako abazithandayo!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 🔵 Together, choose two ingredients, and ask your teen to prepare a meal using them. For example: chicken and spinach, tomatoes and rice, maize and pumpkin.
text: 🔵 Ndawonye, khetha izithako ezimbili, bese ucela osemusha wakho enze isidlo ngazo. Njengesibonelo: inkukhu nomfino, utamatisi nerayisi, impuphu nethanga.

SourceText: 📝 If you enjoy the meal, make it something your family eats weekly and ask your teen to write it down for you, give the meal a name, and explain how to make it.
text: 📝 Uma ukuthokozela ukudla, kwenze kube into umndeni ozoyidla masonto onke futhi ungacela ingane yakho ikubhalele, ikuqambe igama lokho kudla nokuthi uchaze ukuthi kwenziwa kanjani.

SourceText: ✨ If your teen notices that you are learning from their cooking, it will boost their confidence!
text: ✨ Uma ingane yakho iqaphela ukuthi ufunda ekuphekeni kwayo, kuzokhulisa ukuzethemba kwayo!

SourceText: 🍚 Create a new dish with your teen using ingredients they love!
text: 🍚 Yenza isidlo esisha nengane yakho usebenzisa izithako abazithandayo!

SourceText: *Reflect on the positive*
text: *Khumbula, uhlaziye ngokuhle*

SourceText: Spread Positivity! 🌈
text: Sabalalisa okuhle!🌈

SourceText: 💡 Together, take a minute to think about all the things you did today.
text: 💡 Ndawonye, thatha iminithi lokucabanga ngazo zonke izinto ozenzile namuhla.

SourceText: ☀️ Take turns sharing one positive or fun thing that happened. This could be something small, like feeling good because you cleaned the house, or something big, like spending time with family and friends.
text: ☀️ Shintshanani ngokwabelana ngento eyodwa eyakhayo noma ejabulisayo eyenzekile. Lokhu kungaba yinto encane, njengokuzizwa ujabule ngoba uhlanze indlu, noma into enkulu, njengokuchitha isikhathi nomndeni nabangane.

SourceText: ⏰ Try doing this every day - even more on the days it feels like you have not done anything special.
text: ⏰ Zama ukwenza lokhu nsuku zonke - nakakhulu ngezinsuku lapho kuzwakala sengathi awenzanga lutho olukhethekile.

SourceText: *What’s new?*
text: *Yini entsha?*

SourceText: Learning is fun! 🎓
text: Ukufunda kumnandi! 🎓

SourceText: ❓ Ask your teen to think of a new, fun skill you could learn together.
text: ❓Cela ingane yakho ukuthi icabange ikhono elisha, elimnandi eningalifunda ndawonye.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns trying out the new skill.  Make sure to praise each other and learn and play together!
text: 🔄 Shintshisanani nizama ikhono elisha. Qiniseka ukuthi niyancomana futhi nifunde futhi nidlale ndwawonye!

SourceText: 💛 Approach learning the skill in a kind and fun way, and do not judge your teen or yourself for your ability in the skill.
text: 💛 Ikhono lokufunda liqhamukele ngendlela enomusa nejabulisayo, futhi ungayehluleli ingane yakho noma wena ngokwakho ngekhono lakho kukhono.

SourceText: *Dance moves*
text: *Umdanso*

SourceText: Let's get moving! 👋 Dancing is a great way to exercise, have fun, and bond with your teen at the same time! You both get to express yourselves in a fun, relaxed way.  🎵
text: Masiqhubeke! 👋 Ukudansa kuyindlela enhle yokuzivocavoca, ukuzijabulisa, nobudlelwane nengane yakho ngesikhathi esisodwa! Nobabili nithola ukuveza imizwa yenu ngendlela ejabulisayo, ekhululekile. 🎵

SourceText: This game can be played in pairs or a group with everyone taking turns being the leader:
text: Lo mdlalo ungadlalwa nibabili noma eqenjini nabo bonke abantu bashintshisana ngokuba ngumholi:

SourceText: 📱 Let your teen choose a song they like and create a set of dance moves.
text: 📱 Vumela ingane yakho ikhethe ingoma eyithandayo, ihlanganise izinhlobonhlobo zemidanso.

SourceText: 👀 First person does a dance move and everyone else copies it.
text: 👀 Umuntu wokuqala wenza umdanso bese bonke abanye abantu bayayikopisha.

SourceText: ☀️ Don’t worry about perfecting the dance moves, it’s all about having fun together!
text: ☀️ Ningazikhathazi ngokwenza umdanso ube perfect, injongo ukuthi nizezenzele ubumnandi ndawonye!

SourceText: 💡 If you want to, you can perform your dance for the household!
text: 💡 Uma ufuna, ungadlalela umndeni wakho umdanso!

SourceText: *Dance Activity*
text: *Umsebenzi womdanso*

SourceText: Try something new and learn a dance challenge with your teen! ✨ Have fun!
text: Zama into entsha futhi ufunde umqhudelwano wokudansa nosemusha wakho! ✨ Zijabulise!

SourceText: ⭐ Dancing is a great way to have fun together while being creative and moving your body!
text: ⭐ Ukudansa indlela enhle yokuzijabulisa ndawonye nibe nidala futhi ninyakazisa umzimba!

SourceText: 📱 If your teen uses the app TikTok, suggest doing a dance challenge together.
text: 📱 Uma ngabe osemusha wakho esebenzisa uTikTok, faka isicelo sokuthi nenze umqhudelwano wokudansa ndawonye.

SourceText: 😃 Ask your teen to choose their favourite dance and learn it with them.
text: 😃 Cela osemusha wakho ukuthi akhethe umdanso awuthandayo bese uyawufunda naye.

SourceText: 🎉 It’s okay if you can’t dance well, have fun and try not to take it too seriously!
text: 🎉 Kulungile uma ungakwazi ukudansa kahle, zijabulise futhi uzame ukungayithatheli phezulu kakhulu!

SourceText: 💡 You do not have to post the video to learn the dance. You can keep it as a memory between you and your teen.
text: 💡 Awudingi ukuthumela ividiyo ukuze ufunde umdanso. Ungayigcina njengesikhumbuzo phakathi kwakho nengane yakho.

SourceText: *Check-in chat*
text: *Ingoxo yokubuza impilo*

SourceText: Actively checking in on one another helps to keep relationships healthy! ⭐
text: Ukuqhubeka nibhekana kuyasiza ukuthi nigcine ubudlelwano bunempilo! ⭐

SourceText: Ask each other questions: “What made you happy today?” 👂 “What was difficult today?” 👂 “How can I help you?” 👂
text: Buzanani imibuzo: "Yini ekwenze wajabula namhlanje?" 👂 "Yini ebeyinzima namhlanje?" 👂 "Ngingakusiza kanjani? 👂

SourceText: For this to help, your teen needs to feel safe while sharing things with you. Be open to their responses. 💚 Teens tend to be more honest when they trust that what they say will not be used against them later.
text: Ukuze lokhu kusize, umntwana wakho osemusha udinga ukuzizwa ephephile ngenkathi ukutshela izinto. Zivule ukuzwa izimpendulo wakhe. 💚 Intsha ijwayele ukuba neqiniso kakhulu uma bethemba ukuthi abazokusho angeke kusentshiswe ukubalimaza kamuva.

SourceText: Go easy on yourself if your teen does not want to share their problems with you. 💙 Often, teens are afraid to share as they are scared they will get in trouble. Getting upset with them won’t help - keep showing you love them and give them time! 🌷
text: Zikhululekele uma ingane yakho ingafuni ukwabelana nawe ngezinkinga zayo. 💙 Ngokuvamile, ingane iyesaba ukwabelana njengoba yesaba ukuthi izongena enkingeni. Ukucasuka ngabo ngeke kusize - qhubeka ubabonisa ukuthi uyabathanda futhi ubanike isikhathi! 🌷

SourceText: *Express Yourself*
text: *Zichaze*

SourceText: Dancing makes people happy!
text: Ukudansa kwenza abantu bajabule!

SourceText: 🌈 This game can be played in pairs or as a group - stand facing each other or in a circle.
text: 🌈 Lo mdlalo ungadlalwa nibabili noma eqenjini - ima nibhekane noma endingilizini.

SourceText: 🎵 Together, choose a fun and upbeat song to play and a person to start the game by creating one dance move.
text: 🎵 Ndawonye, khethani ingoma emnandi enokujabula idlale bese umuntu aqale umdlalo ngokuthi adale umdanso owodwa.

SourceText: 👀 The person to their right must copy that dance move and add their own move to it.
text: 👀 Umuntu ongasesandleni sokudla kufanele akopishe lowo mdanso bese efaka umdanso wakhe.

SourceText: ✨ Go around the circle, each person adding their own dance move to the full song.
text: ✨ Jikelezani endingilizini, umuntu nomuntu afake umdanso wakhe engomeni ephelele.

SourceText: 🔄 The first one who forgets someone's dance moves or does it in the wrong order chooses the next song and starts the game again.
text: 🔄 Owokuqala okhohlwayo umdanso womunye umuntu noma oyenza nge-oda engalungile ukhetha ingoma elilandelayo bese uqala umdlalo futhi.

SourceText: 🎉 Try new dance moves with this game and have fun!
text: 🎉 Zama ukunyakaza komdanso omusha ngalo mdlalo futhi ujabule!

SourceText: *2 Truths, 1 Lie*
text: *Amaqiniso amabili, Amanga awodwa*

SourceText: This is a fun, quick game, and the point of it is to learn things about each other. Make your answers as interesting as possible! 🎨
text: Lona umdlalo ojabulisayo, osheshayo, futhi inhloso yawo wukufunda izinto ngomunye nomunye. Yenza izimpendulo zakho zibe mnandi ngangokunokwenzeka! 🎨

SourceText: 💡 Think of 3 facts about yourself. 2 must be true, 1 must be a lie.
text: 💡 Cabanga amaqiniso awu- 3 ngawe. Kufanele okubili kube iqiniso, okukodwa kube amanga.

SourceText: 🔷 Here are some examples: I hate bananas, I have travelled to Kenya, my favourite subject in school was maths.
text: 🔷 Nazi izibonelo: Ngiyawuzonda ubhanana, ngake ngaya eKhenya, isifundo sami ebengisithanda esikolweni bekuyizibalo.

SourceText: 👀 Share the facts with your teen and ask them to guess which one is a lie.
text: 👀 Yethula amaqiniso kumfana noma intombazane yakho futhi ubabuze baqagele ukuthi iyiphi engamanga.

SourceText: 🔄 Now ask them to do the same, and guess theirs.
text: 🔄 Manje bacele ukuthi benze okufanayo, bese uqagela okwabo.

SourceText: Did you learn anything new about your teen, or did they learn anything new about you? 💛
text: Ingabe kukhona okusha okufundile mayelana nomntwana wakho, noma kukhona okusha umntwana akufundile ngawe? 💛

SourceText: *Yes, No or Maybe*
text: *Yebo, Cha noma Mhlawumbe*

SourceText: Are you tired of hearing your teen say yes, no, or maybe to all of your questions? Turn your chat into a game, and don’t allow one-word answers. 🎈
text: Ingabe ukhathele ukuzwa ingane yakho ithi yebo, cha, noma mhlawumbe kuyo yonke imibuzo yakho? Shintsha ingxoxo yakho ibe umdlalo, futhi ungamvumeli ukuthi aphendule ngegama elilodwa. 🎈

SourceText: 🔴 Teens are known to give one-word answers to avoid talking.
text: 🔴 Intsha yaziwa ngokuphendula ngegama elilodwa ukugwema ukukhuluma.

SourceText: 💡 When you would like to really know how your teen is doing, you can turn your chat into a game.
text: 💡 Ungafisa ukwazi nini ukuthi umfana noma intombazane yakho unjani, ungashintsha ingxoxo yenu ibe ngumdlalo.

SourceText: ⭐ Take turns asking each other questions. The only rule is that you cannot use one-word responses, such as Yes, No, Maybe, Fine, and Okay.
text: ⭐ Shintshisanani nibuzana imibuzo. Umthetho owodwa ukuthi anikwazi ukuphendula ngegama elilodwa, njengo Yebo, Cha, Mhlawumbe, Kahle, futhi Kulungile.

SourceText: ⚽ You can ask about things your teen likes or what they did today. For example, how was your day? What are you excited for? Is there anything worrying you?
text: ⚽ Ungayibuza ngezinto ezithandayo nokuthi enyzeni namhlanje ingane yakho. Isibonelo, belunjani usuku lwakho? Yini oyijabulele? Ngabe kukhona okukukhathazayo?

SourceText: 🔄 It is important to let your teen ask a question as well. Trust is built when your teen can see that you are also sharing your life with them, and not only trying to learn about their life.
text: 🔄 Kubalulekile ukuthi uvumele ingane yakho nayo ibuze umbuzo. Ukwethembana kwakheka lapho ingane yakho ibona ukuthi nawe wabelana nayo ngempilo yakho, awugcini ngokuzama ukufunda ngempilo yayo.

SourceText: *Movie World*
text: *Umhlaba Wefilimu*

SourceText: Leaving the busy and stressful world behind can be good for our health. 🌱 Take a moment to escape with your teen by creating a superhero story together!
text: Ukushiya umhlaba ophithizelayo nokhathazanayo ngemuva kungaba yinto enhle ekuphileni kwethu. 🌱 Thatha umzuzu ube nomntwana wakho niqambe indaba engeqhawe ndawonye!

SourceText: 🎈 Ask your teen to imagine that they are a superhero and what their superpowers would be. Flying? Time travel? Mind reading? Super Strength?
text: 🎈 Cela ingane yakho yakho ukuthi icabange ukuthi uyiqhawe nokuthi amandla akhe angaba yini. Ukundiza? Ukubuyela emuva esikhathini? Ukufunda umqondo? Amandla Amakhulu?

SourceText: ✨ Ask them how they would use these superpowers, and why.
text: ✨ Yibuze ukuthi ingawasebenzisa kanjani amandla ayo, futhi kungani.

SourceText: 🌈 Help them give their superhero a name, an outfit, and a sidekick, and act it out. If your teen does not want to act, that is fine - talking about it is just as good!
text: 🌈 Siza ukuthi iqambe iqhawe layo igama, izingubo zokugqoka, nomngani wakhe bese niyalingisa. Uma ingane yakho ingafuni ukulingisa, kulungile - ukukhuluma ngakho kwanele!

SourceText: 👑 Now, let them make up a superhero for you. Play the part! You can ask questions, like who the villain would be, or how you became a superhero.
text: 👑 Manje, badedele bakwakhele iqhawe. Lingisa! Ungabuza imibuzo, njengokuthi isitha kungaba ngubani, noma ube yiqhawe kanjani.

SourceText: 💡 Create a story - what happens to the characters? Is it an action story? Is it a thriller, space, sport, adventure, or romance?
text: 💡 Dala indaba - kwenzekani kubalingiswa? Indaba eyokulwa? Indaba egijimisa igazi, umkhathi, ezimidlalo, indaba eyohambo, noma ezothando?

SourceText: ➡️ Next time you play this game, you could create a new story or superhero with your teen or continue the story you started together.
text: ➡️ Ngokuzayo uma udlala lo mdlalo, ungaqamba indaba entsha noma engeqhawe elinamandla nomntwana wakho noma niqhubeke nendaba eniyiqale ndawonye.

SourceText: Exercise is a great way to spend time together and it is so good for your health. 🌱 Find a sport or exercise that both you and your teen want to do and try it out together!
text: Ukuzivocavoca indlela enhle yokuchitha isikhathi ndawonye futhi kulungele ukuphila kwenu. 🌱 Thola umdlalo noma indlela yokuzivocavoca wena nomntwana wakho bese niyazama ndawonye!

SourceText: ⚽ Together you can walk, run, play soccer, swim, dance, or do any other sport..
text: ⚽ Ndawonye ningahamba, nigijime, nidlale ibhola, nibhukude, nidanse, noma nenze omunye umdlalo..

SourceText: 🔄 If you or your teen do not like the first exercise you pick, try a new exercise.
text: 🔄 Uma wena noma umfana noma intombazane yakho esanda kweva eshumini nambili ningawuthandi umsebenzi wokuqala owukhethayo, zama umsebenzi omusha.

SourceText: *Make up a story*
text: *Qamba inganekwane*

SourceText: Creating stories together is a great way to learn the art of storytelling - and to build your teen’s creativity! 📖
text: Ukudala izindaba ndawonye indlela enhle yokufunda ubuciko bokuxoxa izindaba - futhi kwakha ikhono lokudala kumfana noma intombazane yakho wakho! 📖

SourceText: 🔟 With your teen, come up with 10 words to use. They can be any words you want! For example: banana, spaceship, fish, water, painting, wasp nest, cooking, wedding.
text: 🔟 Cabangani amagama awu- 10 ninomntwana wakho eningawasebenzisa. Kungaba inoma imaphi amagama eniwafunayo! Isibonelo: ubhanana, umkhumbi wasemkhathini, inhlanzi, amanzi, ukupenda, isidleke somnyovu, ukupheka, umshado.

SourceText: 🎂 Start your story with, “Once upon a time, there was a…” and make sure you use one of the words from the list in your sentence. For example, “Once upon a time, there was a family who worked on a *banana* farm.”
text: 🎂 Qala indaba yakho ngokuthi, "Kwasukasukela, kwakukhona i..." bese uqiniseka ukuthi usebenzisa elilodwa lamagama kuhlu lwakho. Isibonelo, "Kwasukasukela, kwakukhona umndeni owawusebenza efamini *labhanana*."

SourceText: 📝 Let your teen make up the next sentence using another word from the list.
text: 📝 Vumela ingane yakho ukuthi icabange umusho olandelayo ngokusebenzisa elinye igama kuhlu lwamagama eniwacabangile.

SourceText: 🔄 Take turns until you have used as many words from the list as you can, or until you have finished your story.
text: 🔄 Shintshisanani nize nisebenzise wonke amagama kuhlu eningawa sebenzisa, noma nize niqede indaba yenu.

SourceText: 🔔 Be as creative as possible with your story and do not tell your teen what to say. It does not need to be a real story to be a good story!
text: 🔔 Yiba nobuciko kangangokho onakho ngale ndaba yakho futhi ungamtsheli ingani ukuthi athini amagama ewacabangile. Akudingeki ukuthi kuze kube indaba yangempela ukuze kube indaba enhle!

SourceText: 🎁 Ask your teen what their favourite part of the story was, and tell them yours!
text: 🎁 Buza ingane yakho ukuthi iyiphi ingxenye ayithanda kakhulu endabeni, bese uyitshela eyakho!

SourceText: *Take A Pause with your teen*
text: *Thatha Ikhefu nomntwana wakho*

SourceText: Take a pause with your teen. This helps them deal with stress in a healthy way!
text: Thatha ikhefu nomntwana wakho. Lokhu kubasiza ukubhekana nokukhathazeka ngendlela enempilo!
